Reviews.Title: “Good time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: denchris2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location and on the Grand Canal, although it was a shame our room did not have a good view (at the side, out to the back). Room was fine and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice with a good variety althugh for the "hot" food it was scrambled eggs and slightly cooked bacon every day.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel by train, this is your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Waldmeier
Reviews.Content: It can be hard to travel in Venice with heavy luggage. Just steep bridges (if any!) and no easy taxi access to many hotels. But this hotel is closest to the main train station (Santa Lucia). You will be happy for the short distance (100 m) when you arrive or have to leave. In front of the hotel is one of the few bridges over Canale Grande (Ponte degli Scalzi) and stations for the Vaporetta (water taxis) are close. All the Venice attractions are with this taxis in a range of 20 minutes. The hotel itself is a classic Venetian hotel: The reception with an old glass chandelier, the floor corridors narrow and arranged around the stairways. The single(!) elevator for 3 people is slow but working. We had a Classic room. It is refurbished recently with a kingsize bed and the bath room is really nice with lot of white marble. If you are lucky and the room doesn't face the main street, you will have a good sleep. The main street is very loud, because the many tourists carry their wheel luggage to the train station early in the morning. Breakfast is okay in quality and quantity. But nothing special to remark. Overall: Be prepared to the prize level of touristic Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position - weak four stars”
Reviews.Author: Vierdank
Reviews.Content: If I dare to make a general reflection: Italy is getting behind central Europe and Scandinavia in hotel standard. Knowing Venice is a tourist trap, making hotel nights expensive, I'm beginning to see a pattern though in the Italian hotel classification. Meaning you should take away one star when comparing hotels with many other European countries. Hotel Bellini has a great location a bit away from the crowded centre with the railway station next door and all the major Vaporetta lines in front of the entrance. Bellini faces the Scalzi bridge, which is one of the few bridges over Canal Grande. You can use the Vaporetta to go to all major attractions, but a walk is nearly as easy; in around 20 min you reach St Marco. If you travel with luggage and you're new to the city, you'll be grateful to skip complicated routes to a hotel in a small alley. Remember: Venice is a labyrinth and is not easily navigated even with a good map, especially when carrying a travel kit... Bellini consists of several buildings, the major one being a typical older venetian house. Moderately renovated and refurbished it is a bit worn. Our room (standard room in the main building) was very small, not more than around 12 sq m (40 sq foot). The superior rooms would be larger. The beds are OK. The AC/heating was not in operation. A few rooms faces the very busy street and should probably be avoided. Our room, facing a side street, was quiet. Amenities average, mini bar expensive. WiFi available in the lobby, but not in the rooms. Nice and affordable bar in the lobby. One, rather slow, elevator serving the main building. Breakfast without any extras, but OK (scrambled eggs, bacon and salami very good!). There are (too) many flaws in standard and service to make this hotel reach four genuine stars. Considering it bears the name of the often rather luxurious Boscolo chain you are in for a disappointment. But if you ignore the Boscolo mark and accept it as a fairly good three star tourist hotel then by all means you can stay here. Just don't expect it to be anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Annandale_VABill_ON
Reviews.Content: Very good location for train station, and easy 1/2 block walk on the left. Clean room and a friendly staff. Not a central location but near the water taxi, shopping and lots of eateries. We asked the front desk clerk for a moderately priced restaurant idea and he suggested the Columbina (sp). We found the place ok but the service was slow, prices high and frankly the food was mediocre at best. Stay at the hotel but seek other dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transport”
Reviews.Author: CanberraRonnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old but the room we had was fine. It was clean and reasonably large. It was very close to the train station and bus drop off. Was a bit of a walk to St Marco Piazza but this is part of being in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, could use an update”
Reviews.Author: jasondevaney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a VERY convenient location - right near the Ferrovia train station/vaporetto stop, which you can use to go everywhere. It's an easy walk to a lot of places too - since one of the bridges over the grand canal is right in front of the hotel. the hotel itself is a little dated and dingy. it could use an update, but that would probably just make it more expensive. it's a good bang for the buck - if you're looking to explore venice, it's great. if you're looking for a romantic hotel to spend time in, it's not for you.

Reviews.Title: “2 star”
Reviews.Author: Carla L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bellini on 8 and 9 April 2012, what a disappointment! The hotel room was extremely old and outdated, broken light fittings, broken electrical points, no replacement of toilet paper, no option of english TV channels, no room service, the breakfast was terrible, stale bread, horrible coffee. The reception staff were friendly, but the rest are so unfriendly. Not sure how they can still be classified as a 4 star hotel. If this was a 2 star then I would expect what we got! Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming...”
Reviews.Author: cyoung0329
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a converted Venetian Palace with Murano glass chandeliers and light fixtures. Easy easy walking distance from the train station. Airport water taxi takes you to the dock in front of the hotel. The docks for the vaporettos are right outside the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly! My room was tiny but the Venetian wall covering and the light fixtures were lovely. It was very clean and comfortable! However...I had no telephone in the room and the only internet was a communal computer in the lobby. It's free but since there is only one many people were competing to use it! The breakfast was so so. Not much variety and instant eggs....Everything in Venice was an easy walk or a quick boat ride from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: Stan Q
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from the train station with bags (< 100 meters). Large room and small but functional bathroom. Room had character although it did get warm/humid (there in March on several warm days and air conditioning did not appear to be turned on yet).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GustavoBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: In Venize is very difficult to get your hotel with your lugagge because there are not cars and the taxis (boats) are too expensive. So you have to take a vaporetto (boat bus) and then walk crossing bridges (with steps) upto your hotel. This hotel is 1 block from the train station and 2 from the bus station, where shuttles from the airport arrive. In front of the Gran Canal, so you can walk through Venize or take the famous vaporettos. Good size for the rooms, nice breakfast and excellent front desk clercks.

Reviews.Title: “Bellini not so... bellino”
Reviews.Author: buzzmaz
Reviews.Content: We stay at the bellini one night on the way to vienna because the hotel was near to the station. The hotel clearly need some cosmetic updating, and is not worth the 800 euro full rate affixed behind the bedroom door. Nevertheless since we paid less than 100Â£ with breakfast for a 4star hotel we find it acceptable considering the high cost of venice lodgings. The rooms are definetly quite small but it is common in venice especially if it is an old building, and the tv is as old as the hotel, but who want to watch tv if you spend one night in venice?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gtravel_mn
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next door to the train station, professional and efficient staff. Walking toward St. Mark Square through the Cannaregio Sestriere is fun and entertaining. The hotel is furnished in typical Venetian style, rooms are nice and pretty size comparing to other hotels. Large breakfast buffet with salty and sweet items. Price on line with Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Mor66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 star but I would rate it 3 star compared to other hotels I have stayed in. Having said that the hotel was perfect for us, we stayed 3 nights in May. The hotel is in the best location next to the train station (no noise though) right in front of the Water Taxis. Venice is possibly the most beautiful place I have been in Europe, everyone says it is expensive and smelly but we found restaurants that were very reasonable and the temperature was 27 degress and the water did not smell, not in May anyway. If you eat in restaurants in the Square then the prices go up but walk the side streets and you will stumble upon some lovely cafes/restaurants. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot coment, it was a place to stay so we could explore the city and for this is was perfect. I would stay at this hotel again purely because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen A
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location right next to the train station & in the heart of Venice. After emailing in advance saying that I would propose in Venice, they offered me a free room upgrade with private balcony. Room was very Venetian in the decoration, with grand chandeliers and great paintings. Nice & friendly staff. The room was very big & had recently been uodated. Didn't spend much time in the hotel bar or to eat as Venice has so much to explore. They did recommend some great local restaurants that were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Agree that it's overrated”
Reviews.Author: KLPLB
Reviews.Content: Overall Venice has a very strong smell, but they tried to cover it up at the Bellini Hotel. Whatever they used, I found more objectionable than the Venice smell. My bathroom had mildew, and the attachment to hold the shower head was broken (just a hole), so I had to hold it, and water got everywhere. There was no luggage rack, so my suitcase had to go on the floor or on the marble-top desk. When I complained I was told this is Venice, and everything is very small and old. I found the location convenient and breakfast OK. WiFi was free in the lobby (no reception in the room). They have a computer, you must rent the keyboard or use touch screen (I didn't try, I used my iPhone).

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: PeterXAus
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel . For me it is definitely not 4* standard. Staff always seems to be stressed and not too friendly. The location is very close to the railway-station and not to far from the center . The breakfast room is very small and it often gets very loud as there are lots and lots of coach tourists. The best thing for us was a small rooftop terrace , where we took our dinner . There is a pizzeria and an Italian fast food restaurant called Brek nearby . Beware of the moscitos in the room. We found hundreds. The bathroom is tiny . The view from the window into a narrow road was not too nice. I think that this hotel is overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Venetian hotel with lots of charme”
Reviews.Author: ungerhausen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful classik Venetian hotel right accross from a Vaporetto stop and next to the train station. Breakfast is served in a beautiful room lit by Venetian glas chandeliers and there are hot and cold choises. Rooms are small but beautifully furnished, the bathrooms are totaly tiled with marble. Friendly, multy lingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right next to the train station and across from the Grand Canal. If you have never been to Venice before and are hauling luggage, this is an ideal spot to stay. The other nice thing is that there is a water bub stop right out front that connects to multiple routes. The hotel itself was quiet, but a little older. The bathroom was redone but the room itself needed some updating. Most of the staff spoke English and there was free wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandycp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just in a perfect location! To get there, you simply hop on a bus outside the airport and pay e5 for a 20 minute ride direct to Piazale Roma and a 5 minute walk over the bridge to the hotel. Alternatively, if you prefer, there is a waterbus station right outside. San Marco is a gorgeous 30 minute stroll away (unless you stop for coffees and browsing in the gorgeous shops as we did) and Rialto just 20 minutes. It is also ideally placed for some great restaurants but do go off the main tourist route of Lista di Spagna. We loved Colombina (10 minute walk from hotel), Gam Gam (5 minute walk and great Jewish food. Never had it before...so tasty and varied) Cafe Verro (10 minute walk) for tapas made by the fab matriach of this family business, Fontana (just along from Gam Gam) is also a great place, just on the banks off the main stretch and casa Bonita, along the same stretch of ban side. (see my reviews for more info of these) The staff are friendly and so helpful and the decor and rooms of this C18th hotel are gorgeous, Venetian glass everywhere and very quiet, despite being on the main route into Venice (and we were there for 5 nights over NY!) The hotel does not have a restaurant but has a lovely little bar and does a good breakfast buffet. All in all, we will certainly go back to the hotel for the location (with 3 day travel cards at around 36e each, we saved a bomb on being able to walk everywhere), the staff (esp. Patrick on reception) and the beauty of Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, right near train, overlooking Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: MartiNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is NOT your standard "near the train station" hotel. Just steps to the left of the station exit, it is beautifully appointed, quiet, elegant, and ON the Grand Canal. Lots of shops and restaurants right outside your door, but inside, a sanctuary. Helpful, English-speaking staff, lovely breakfast in classic Venetian splendor, elevator and easy access to both the train and the vaporetti to get you around Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveller0303
Reviews.Content: My only regret about my stay at this hotel is that I only stayed one night. Our hotel room and bathroom were very spacious. The hotel used to be a 17th century (I think?) palazzo. The hotel has done a great job in maintaining a palazzo-type atmosphere in the rooms. Our room had beautiful gold fabric wall paper with a huge murano chandelier. The ceilings were easy 20 ft high with tall windows and ceiling-to-floor curtains. The furniture was also lovely and looked as though they could have been antiques. Our room also had a view of the grand canal (not the most spectacular part of the grand canal, but still a view). The service was also very good. The hotel was very helpful in giving me advice about which bus I should take and what time it leaves. The hotel has breakfast but we had to leave early so we did not utilize this amenity. The hotel is very close to the train station and also a pretty easy walk to piazzale roma. It's on one of Venice's main roads, so if you've never been to Venice its easy to find and highly accessible. It's also right next to a Vaporetto stop. But because it is in such a high traffic area, there is some street noise, but Venice is a pretty sleepy city so it's not going to keep yo up at night.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: time2travel88
Reviews.Content: To be honest I had no idea where to book a hotel in Venice and we stumbled upon The Boscolo Hotel Bellini the night before we were due to arrive. We were so lucky to have found it! It's a fabulous location from the train station, we literally wheeled our bags around the corner! Having just booked 2 nights and being our first visit to Venice the lovely lady at reception presented us with a grand room which had a balcony with views over the Grand Canal! We were so delighted. I loved the character of the room and the turn down service at night added to its charm. Everywhere was easily accessed by walking distance or boat and staff were both friendly and helpful. Venice is a magical place and The Boscolo Hotel Bellini added to our experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient and smart location”
Reviews.Author: bchs74
Reviews.Content: A nice simple hotel away from the crowds. Very nice breakfast. As everyone points out it is one of the few locations you can easily walk your luggage to and from. The walk through Venice is easy. The staff is excellent and helpful. This has been my Venice base on 4 trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, great weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: JasonWM789
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in mid November and had a great time. We got the bus from the airport for 5 Euros each which took us to Piazza Roma and the hotel was a 5 minute walk away so very convenient. We were given room 401 which had a view of the Grand Canal but I believe 402 would have a better view and had a balcony so it might be worth being cheeky and asking if this room is available if you plan on staying here. The room itself was old fashioned but in a good way. If you're looking for modern or contemporary this isn't the place for you but if you're looking for traditional this hotel is a good choice. It's about a 25 minute walk to St Marc's square but if you're with the girlfriend/wife expect to be dragged into the numerous boots, shoes and handbag shops on the way! Lots of restaraunts nearby and most of which are cheaper than the ones around St Marc's square. We found one bar (lots of locals and off one of the main streets) that charged â‚¬1.50 for a glass of house wine so definately worth looking around before deciding on a bar or restaurant to drink/eat at. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, they let me print off my plane tickets at reception and informed us that we had left a few items in the hotel room draw. Overall this hotel is great for a pleasant short stay and conveniently located for travelling around venice (near river boat stop as well), served a nice but simple brekky and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: Norma_Atlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: Tom and I got to Venice after have travelled for a few weeks. We had a LOT of luggage. I selected this hotel because of the proximity to Piazza Roma and the People Mover. We were going on a cruise the next day. We dropped our rental car off at the Marco Polo airport and took the bus into Piazza Roma. Yes the hotel is only a five minute walk from the square. Somehow though a 111 step bridge and 4 HEAVY suitcases do not equate. The porters in the hotel refused to give us any help, stating that would interfer with the water taxis. They were totally rude!!! The water taxi would have been less than a 2 minute ride and still dropped us off a couple of blocks from the hotel. Luckily Tom agreed not to divorce me after his struggles. The lobby of the hotel is quite small. The lounge areas were ok. Our room was also just ok. The carpeting was not clean. Bathroom was fine. Breakfast was right up there with the worst....certainly not close to 4 star standard. The ceiling was leaking over a couple of tables. Tom said the eggs tasted like Marine Corps issue. The juice tasted lke colored water. The bread and what little pastry there was was in cellephane bags. Yuck!!! All in all, we would NEVER stay at this hotel again. Next time we will go to the Hilton where you don't have to fight anything and where they have direct shuttle service to the baggage area of the cruise ships.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel from 18th Century”
Reviews.Author: Matt A
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Principe for my 40th birthday and to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary and we were to stay for 5 nights however there was a problem!!!!! When we went to check-in we were told by reception that there had been a problem with the central computer meaning that they had over booked for the first night only. They asked us if we would mind goiing to another Hotel just down the street which they had arranged for us which was also 4 * and the same facilities. We agreed and ended up in this Hotel Boscolo Bellini. The room 206 was Massive, The Bed was Massive with really high ceiling, a chandelier (maurano glass) with matching wall lights, Antique furniture, Fabric wall covering, A tv, phone air con/ heating, mini bar etc. The bathroom was marble with bath / shower, Toilet and bidet and also had a telephone ???? The view out of the windows wasn't good, It looked down on an allyway. We went out in the evening and when we returned to our room, They had turned our bedsheets back and put a mat at each side of the bed for us (Which was cool) The breakfast was ok, Usual continental style but pletifull. Cant really complain about anything but wouldn't choose this hotel to stay for more than a night or two unless you have a room at the front.

Reviews.Title: “Small.good location attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: cciarlo01
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Location worked for us. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. If you can speak alittle italian the bartender constintino will warm right up to you. We met his beautiful daughter and gave us agreat ristorante to try. Colombino. Grazie , constintino!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: familyworktraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well priced, and overall we had a good experience.It is in need of redecoration (our superior room was both dated and a bit tatty - plus sad corridoors etc). The service given by reception was outstanding - always helpful and cheerful. Location was good - our room at back lacked view but was quiet, but as not close to main sites the very close water bus stop (Ferrovia) was useful - otherwise a lot of walking requiried.The guide books will tell you this is a poor area, but it is vibrant if not smart.Breakfast was good, again good service and plentiful (not enough fresh fruit but lots of alternatives).

Reviews.Title: “A Palace on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: andrini
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, close to the train station, bus station, and Traghetti for taking the water bus all over the area and surrounding islands. There were good restaurants and shopping close by. The front desk staff was great, helpful, and friendly. We really liked Jorge and Patrick who helped with some intricate travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location but could do with a little work...”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Boscolo Bellini Hotel in Venice, Italy. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel to find that the location was very close to both the bus and train station. It is also right on the Grand Canal and within easy walking distance of most of the tourist sights. We had an excellent check in when we arrived, however, the problems started occurring when the receptionist sent us to the fifth floor with the wrong room key. Upon getting into our room we found it was the wrong type of room. Following a 15 minute 'discussion' with reception they gave us another room although it was clear that they didn't want to! This room was fine but wasn't particularly clean and was quite dated. For the amount of time we were in the room, it was fine. The breakfast at the hotel was nothing special but it set us up for the day. If you are looking for somewhere which is inexpensive and in a reasonable location then I would recommend this hotel. However, in saying that, if I was to return to Venice I would not stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Laurie88
Reviews.Content: Venice is less crowded at this time of year, and this hotel is ideal for a short break. Jorge and David on the front desk will make you very welcome and set the scene for the rest of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venice Hotel near Bus and Train stations”
Reviews.Author: moomanmoo
Reviews.Content: In Venice, if you are on ANY budget you need to think of getting to the hotel: You will pull/carry your own bags. This hotel is an easy trek from the bus station (only one bridge) and even closer to the train station. Also, it is right on the Canal public boat transport route. The breakfast is very good and the rooms, while small are very comfortable. NOTE -- they are not honest about their wireless service. It is never on as far as I can tell. Also, this hotel is used by many tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location and good price”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwi22
Reviews.Content: It was a quaint, kind of old fashioned hotel. We had a nice quiet room at the back of the hotel, with a court yard near.It was close to the train station and bus station and also the waterbus,and water taxi stand. Lots of eateries and shops nearby. Good continental breakfast. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ant_walton
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a quiet, clean comfortable hotel near the grand canal, then the Bellini is fine. Right next to the Vaporetto stops, whilst it is osme way from St Marks, it is so easy on the boats. Plenty of foot traffic outside the door as it is on the route from the Railway Station, its next door by the way, to the main sights. Good beds, ok ensuite, nice relaxing enviroment, and ok priced. You could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews and enjoy Venice!”
Reviews.Author: mortyatport
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here as part of a Monogram Tours trip of Italy. This was the only hotel on our trip which was not upgraded. Reading the bad reviews ahead of time, I was quite concerned......don't be, unless you are a picky traveller. If you haven't travelled in Europe before, and you aren't used to the hotel room sizes, yes you'll find it small. However, I have certainly stayed in smaller rooms in Europe - to the point where you almost feel claustrophobic. That is not the case here. Here are the positives: - the room is clean, quaint and cozy - the bed was very comfortable - the Air Conditioning worked very well, almost too cold - the hotel is in a great location (more about that below) - the room decor is very European - not "outdated" - as with much of Italy, the church bells are a charming way to wake up!! Here are the negatives: - the elevators in the hotel are very small, this is an old building, what do you expect....we found them adorable - the breakfast was a little sparse....you won't go hungry, there just isn't a HUGE selection - but the food was fine - we did run out of hot water one day in the shower About the location: - directly in front of the hotel is the water bus stop "Ferrovia". There are three different "Ferrovia" stops, if you will. You have to look at the route #'s when you get to the stop. The one directly in front of the hotel, as opposed to closer to the train station, will take you directly to Murano on the DM line. - there are many restaurants and shops nearby - just follow Lista di Spagna outside of the hotel and you'll find them - it's very obvious So enjoy - yes perhaps it's not four star but I've stayed in much, much worse than this. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise birthday treat gone wrong!”
Reviews.Author: bigshas
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Voyage Prive as a special treat for my husband's 60th birthday. Trust me, this hotel is not a 4 star. From the room we were given it would just scrape a 3 star. Our room was supposedly a double superior. More like a coffin in fact. When we were lying in bed we could both touch the tatty fabric covered walls on either side. There was nowhere to put our suitcase so it just had to live in the very limited floor space with most of our clothes still in it. No chest of drawers. Just a tatty wardrobe with 8 hangers. The bathroom had scale on the tiles, the shower screen didn't fit properly on the bath and was mouldy, one of the taps was broken, there were black marks on the bottom of the bath and dirty red marks on the side of the bath. In a 4 star hotel I would expect toothpaste and hair conditioner at the very least and tea/coffee making facilities. None of these!!! When I went down to complain, the receptionist was very dismissive and said of course it was 4 star and to go and look at any other the other hotels in the street!! Bloody rude. Sadly they had my money otherwise I would have left there and then. Having looked at all the pictures on the website, none of them show a room like ours. Shameful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars if you ask me”
Reviews.Author: Lanz6051
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel, and we were told it was 4 stars. Given that rating, we expected a lot better. The staff were very friendly and helpful, however the room decor was very outdated and we also experienced no hot water in the shower for the duration of our stay, which was the main complaint. However the good points were the excellent location next to the train/bus stations and Grand Canal, inclusive breakfast, and the room was quite spacious. There's also a great pizza place (Au Oche) just a few doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TataSnows
Reviews.Content: Wow if u stay here request the top floor room think it was room 509 We stayed in many hotels in Europe & this was without a doubt the best. Eveything u want to know was wonderful, I want to go back & stay a week.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy1523
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews I was actually dreading staying at this Hotel. However, we were really plesantly suprised. The location was fantastic, when we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a superior room, no extra charge. Room was fine, not enourmous, but then we didn't plan on spending our weekend in our room. it was decorated in typical venician style, bathroom was clean, beds were comfy and the beds changed and rooms cleaned daily. The breakfast wasn't fantastic, but there was hot coffee, Tea, toast, cold meats, cheese, bread etc,. As for the bells ringing and waking you, you are staying in a city with 118 churches, So I think anywhere you choose to stay you may get woken by bells, honestly, some people moan for moaning sake. St Marks square was about 20 minutes walk, but a plesant walk, you can see and take in lots of things on route (and also get lost!!),We had a great time, its a busy city with lots of people all wanting to see a piece of venice, no different to going to Paris/Barcelona/London etc. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just not as expected....”
Reviews.Author: Italia2011_11
Reviews.Content: We HAD to stay here because it was the only hotel that our travel agency could book in Venice. The only good point was that it was really close to the train station, and we had ridden the train up from Florence. Other than that, yuck. We had a 1:30 am fire alarm that only about half the people in our group even heard, it turned out to be a false alarm, but in an old hotel like that.. SCARY! The phones didn't work, the television didn't work, til someone from the front desk came up and fiddled with it, and we had NO HOT WATER for our showers!!! That sucked. Our room was approximately 10 feet by 10 feet. It was clean, but the bathroom had water leaking from the bathroom above, it had foam in it, so I assume it was from the shower. Don't plan to sleep in... it is right next to a church that has clanging bells early in the morning. We also asked for a wakeup call, that never came, and we almost missed a tour that was scheduled. We had to get them to come knock on our door the day of our departure so we wouldn't miss our flight back to the US. It is NOT close to St. Marks Basilica, so if that's what you want, book elsewhere. It is just about as far from St. Marks as you can get in Venice. We will not stay here, not recommend to anyone we know to stay here. Scary elevator too. It jumps and drags before it stops at your floor. Thumbs definitely down. Venice has much much better to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay, Very Close to the Train”
Reviews.Author: StephNewYork
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline. I would probably not stay here again although the location was right next to the train so it was easy to get to our next stop in Florence. The location is a GOOD 25 minute walk to San Marco's and it would have been nice to be closer. The room was warn and the bathroom had a smell. It wasn't terrible, but just not great. It needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: sylviev0yage
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 days in Venice , we loved it...The hotel is good located and easy to find, the staff was very helpful... We had problem (noise) with the AC, but the next day they changed us room, and the second room was great, very clean, comfortable with excellent decor... Pay your attention to the mosquitoes and do not open the windows. I can only say that the breakfast was average.....Finally for Venice and the money we paid i recommend the Boscolo Bellini Hotel and i would like to stay again (to the same triple excellent room) for my next visit to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Long week-end in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Eva B
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, wi-fi not working for days! One would expect toothpaste in the bathroom at 4 star hotel ! Eating out is simply extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: ljmarler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walkable, with cases from the main taxi drop off or train station. The staff are friendly and helpful. the rooms are a good size but no view in ours. The only negative is the complex corridors and lifts- the hotel is not huge but some floors are not accessible from each lift and the lobby was not acessible by stairs from our floor, lifts are tiny too. Hate to think what would happen in a fire.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenfarmer0817
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel pays for itself. Very easy to find, extrememly easy to travel around the city, great nightlife, shops and restaurants are right outside the door. The rooms are everything your would expect from Venice. Smaller yet comfortable. The AC worked great, and the shower worked great! No complaints. There are definately some extremely hidden and secluded areas in Venice, this hotel is not in one of those. We have nothing but fantastic things to say about this hotel. We have been recommending this hotel to all people we have spoken to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IreneBlag
Reviews.Content: BELLINI, Venice is a very good hotel with a perfect location - on Canal Grande, just a few steps from the railway station as well as the water bus station. The windows of our room overlooked Scalzi church and we woke up to its bells, perfect music in the morning. (Can you imagine that thereâ€™re 117 churches in Venice?) The rooms are nicely furnished fitting the interior style of 18th-century patrician palazzo â€“ in red and gold. And they are quite spacious with a well-sized tub and amenities. The reception service provided us with a city map, booked concert tickets and was rather helpful. Iâ€™d recommend the hotel to anyone, including newly wedded couples. Tip: The hotel offers good, yet standard breakfast, so try numerous cafes outside which serve great coffee, fresh juice, cannoli and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed five times - wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: morrisNorthEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab location. I have been coming here since1999. Right opposite one of the four bridges over the Grande Canal, near the railway station with vapretto stop outside and a private water taxi mooring. The hotel is very European and I notice a lot of the bad reviews are from USA. Rooms are not massive, but they are nicely furnished and I have not had a problem with the bathrooms. I would say that I have had better breakfasts - but it really it has always been nice. There public areas are very well decorated and I have always found the staff to be charming. From the roof terrace there are fantasitc views.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannon C
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was decent and the room clean, but this is in no way a five star hotel despite their claims. The air conditioning was nearly non-existent and we frequently had to go other places to get cool. We also woke up hot at night. The shower was terrible with the water temperatures alternating between freezing and scalding. Also, there was absolutely NO internet at the hotel. They claim the hotel was struck by lightening and that nobody in Europe can fix the problem. There was also no room service, restaurant, fitness center or spa -- all of which are present in a five star hotel. Also, though there was a bar on the property, but no bar tender. There was also NO POOL and NO SPA, though they advertise it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting.”
Reviews.Author: Hettie123
Reviews.Content: 4 star makes you think fabulous food, excellent rooms, brilliant staff. The Bellini has awful food, breakfast was burnt fatty bacon and eggs made from powder both which were stone cold amongst other delights such as slightly stale bread and croissants. The rooms are small, have iffy a/c, are not that clean (black mould in bathroom) and are just generally very tired. The staff after being asked to make our room into a twin twice did not and at other times took their sweet time getting round to talking to you at the desk when it was only you waiting or infact if there were lots of us waiting. not a pleasant stay, but yes a good location next time i will stay at the hotel principe down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a top location.”
Reviews.Author: robrobe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the train station and in a location that makes it very easy to get around Venice. It is walking distance to everything and has two shuttle boat stops nearby. Lots of shopping and restaurants are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJShank
Reviews.Content: This had all the comforts of home and the staff was so nice and right in the best area! I would recommend this hotel to any one that needs to walk any where!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: KarenJ008
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very handy. If you are an independent traveler it is within easy walking distance from the bus terminal and the people mover to take you to the cruise terminal. Situated on the Grand Canal and just 15 to 20 minutes walk to St Marks Sq. It is very charming and surrounded by bars and restaurants. Few minutes walk to the train station too. Would not hesitate to stay in the Boscolo again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews from fellow guests”
Reviews.Author: st8sman
Reviews.Content: Just outside the railway station and overlooking the Grand Canal the hotel was excellently situated for water taxis to the main sites in Venice and for the journey to and from the airport. Our long narrow double room at the back of the hotel lacked light but was quieter than those overlooking the canal at the front. The television kept telling us there was no signal and our telephone was one of a number which did not work. We were informed that the Hotel did not have internet access because of an earlier lightening strike. Although the linen was changed daily the other items in the bathroom were not replaced and an empty tissue box on the wall remained empty through our stay. The upper floors are not interlinked and it meant we only had one lift to our area while to use the stairs meant going outside on a metal fire escape. Fortunately different areas of the hotel have independent power supplies and a series of power cuts only lasted for a few minutes each. The hotel serves what it describes as an American breakfast in a very pleasant room. The yoghurts were tasty but most of the food and drinks served were of poor quality. Other guests at the hotel gave a mixed view of their rooms and access to them.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and a very nice room”
Reviews.Author: sylk1967
Reviews.Content: As expected, the rooms aren't large like U.S. standards but it was so nice with the beautiful decor. It's just what you expect from romantic Venice...like reliving history. I would say that this hotel is the best place to stay as it's only 2 minutes walk from the train station and the vaporetto. Also, all the shops and restaurants are all outside the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: LoveKW2011
Reviews.Content: Very close to the train station but that is about the only positive about this hotel. We recently stayed here on our honeymoon with a semiguided tour and actually asked to switch hotels but weren't able to. The rooms are not taken care of...there were rips and stains on the carpet, cracks in the walls and ceilings, no working phone, and the shower head was handheld with no place to hang it so when you showered you were freezing cold! I would recommend staying somewhere along the canals if I could do it over again!

Reviews.Title: “Take a gas mask before you walk in”
Reviews.Author: Duca22
Reviews.Content: Biggest regret of my life! We paid 500 euros for 2 nIghts!!! We expected a penthouse! The room was so smelly, we asked to be transferred to another. When we got the other room the smell was the same. The water in the shower was boiling hot then extremely freezing. There was no middle. Never again. For breakfast the selection was very poor!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cddarragh
Reviews.Content: This place was a disaster from the moment we walked into it. My #1 suggestion for anyone visiting Venice is this. A lot of people suggest that you stay near the trainstation in Venice so that you do not have to carry your bags through the streets. They are correct that carrying your bags around venice is horrible and water taxis cost a fortune. But the Vaporetto (water bus) service is incredible and their is a stop just outside the trainstation. From there you can easily get on with your luggage and have only a short walk to any number of hotels by the numerous Vaparreto stops. So rather than staying at this dump because it is next to the station find a nicer hotel close to any Vaporetto stop. You'll need a 24 hour Vaporetto ticket anyway and you'll love being closer to St Mark's. Now for why this place was the worst hotel I've stayed in since I could afford one. We showed up and the hotel had screwed up our reservation which almost left us out of luck. We made the reservations months in advance, had a confirmaiton letter, and somehow they managed to forget to save a room for us. Luckily someone checked out a night early as we were standing at the counter and we got their room. (there is a reason they checked out early). The room was small and at first glance looked nice. Venitian glass chandalier, nice bed spread, plenty of marble, but when you looked closesly everything was really a bit dirty. The rooms were much like Venice as a whole, gorgeous on a large scale but don't look at the detail in the corners because it is quite dirty and feels like a place where people have been staying for hundreds of years. The room just felt a bit grimy. Neither the tv nor the phone worked in the room. And the staff only made false promises about wanting to fix them. I can't imagine the main elevator is actually able to pass code. The bell boy was pounding on the control panel trying to get it to work as we brought our bags up, I never tested it for myself again (opting instead for the five flights of stairs). Despite asking the front desk for a nice high quality restaurant they sent us to your standard tourist trap. Don't be fooled by their nice website, this place is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italytwin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the train station and across from the main water taxi/ferry stop on the Grand Canal. Crowded at times; yet plenty of shops, gelato and pizza. Long walk to St. Mark's Square and Hard Rock Cafe (40 min); unless you take the water taxi (6 Euros one way). The room was clean and comfortable. Good size bathroom if you get a bathtub. Typical European breakfast buffet. Lobby and lounge area small for groups; yet lovely decor. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Roxyrex
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for the last 5 nights of our 2 week Italy trip with our friends to celebrate their 25th anniversary....worst hotel of the whole trip!!! Think Seaside Heights (jersey shore) of Venice. If you're a high school or college student that doesn't who just needs a room to drink and sleep-fine for you! If you're an adult who would like a comfortable place to sleep after a fun yet long day of exploring Venice-spend a bit more money and go elsewhere. A/C didn't work in our closet sized room. Paint peeling a carpet filthy. Bedding as old as the hotel possibly (and our mattress smelled like urine!). Chaos in the lobby while checking in (luggage and bags all over the place). Elevator to 5th floor roof space with view was dirty and scary! Breakfast the worst of all of the hotels we had stayed. We wound up checking out after one night after my husband suffered an asthma attack during the night (which he hasn't had in 10 years). Found a Courtyard Marriott by the airport - worth the 15 minute bus ride for a clean hotel with an extremely gracious and professional staff. Also, there was a fire in the Boscolo Bellini hotel a few months ago and their is some construction work going on.

Reviews.Title: “Run don't walk away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pschaffer
Reviews.Content: I felt as though I were staying at a youth hostel in my college days, not a four star hotel. If your travel agent booked you into this location....get out now. In the middle of the train station area...convenient to the train is about the best thing I can say about this location....and the sheets were clean. Rooms old, musty smelling, furnishings of poor quality, elevators groaning...take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel...but!!”
Reviews.Author: DennisApple
Reviews.Content: Generally Italian hotels have great reception and lounge areas but in many cases the rooms appear to be furnished from car boot sales. That is not the case with the Boscolo Bellini Venezia- Murano glass chandeliers and lots of marble PLUS clean sheets and towels each day,The best hotel I have stayed in in Italy.The breakfast is poor-not even any fresh coffee-but there are good cheap alternatives Few rooms actually have a view of the Grand Canal but it is right next to vaportetti and rail stops so access is great. Reasonably priced with mostly helpful staff- the bar man was slow and surly.But reasonable value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Whereshallwego2next?
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location - just steps from the train station. No sooner had we arrived by train, we were checked in and ready to explore wonderful Venice. We stayed here for 4 nights in April. The room was of a reasonable size, very clean and inviting in modern white and brown decor. Bathroom was great - the shower powerful. We really enjoyed breakfast - there was plenty of choice and it was taken in a great room. The decor of the hotel was perfect to our taste, loved the glass and the lounge areas to sit and have a coffee. The hotel is not central - but don't let that put you off. We enjoyed using the vaporetto and purchased the unlimited ticket. For the price compared to other hotels we looked at, we were more than happy with our choice of hotel and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JGP321
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located about two minutes from the train station and right across from the bridge along the Grand Canal. Although lots of action right in front of the hotel, it was very quiet inside. We had a problem with water leakage in the bathroom ceiling the first night due to renovation above and the hotel immediately moved us to a canal view room. Staff were very helpful and spoke very good english. Rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Bathrooms were very nice but a little small. Staff were always accommodating. Breakfast was good and plenty of food selections. Location was good for when you first come and leave Venice using the train, Make sure you get your train ticket for leaving as soon as you arrive otherwise you might find that the next available train is several hours from when you want or need to leave (three hour wait for us). This is due to the crowds in Venice. Take the Valpretto #2 to San Marco, it is a nice short trip. You can walk all over Venice in a day. The only negative was Venice itself, lots of graffiti, hawkers everywhere, very crowed, and lots of buildings that seem somewhat boarded up. Unless you are gaga about the place, one day is plenty but if you are travelling by train that may be tough to meet timelines unless you have tickets beforehand. One afternoon, one night, and part of the next day are plenty in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, unclean and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Smiley8888
Reviews.Content: Between my first room (5th floor) was a door in the corridor which locked from the other side - cutting off the only access to the exit. This door was propped open by an empty tissue box! After insisting that I be moved, I got a room which literally stank. - I'm not talking about some old cigarette smoke; the place reeked of something awful (perhaps from the carpet), to the point of preventing sleep. The bathroom was quite grubby, with mould in the shower recess. Throughout the whole stay, the staff where at best indifferent, at worst just rude. The place has one thing going for it - its location. Otherwise, it is simply the worst hotel I've ever been in. I would advise you to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for price located near the bus stop - which is very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: garveyc
Reviews.Content: You will not be blown away by this hotel, but it is a clean, nicely located hotel along the Grand Canal. We purchased our room on Priceline.com and were happy with the room and rate.

Reviews.Title: “great location- large rooms”
Reviews.Author: chanplc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just next to train station and infront of the main ferry pier. The restaurants adjacent was great in both taste and resonabley priced. Hotel staff exceptionally helpful & helped us to book for concerts- very very reliable and friendly staff (esp Angela and Stefania). Good quality breakfast. Room is of good size. Out room is on the ground floor, windows opens out to a lawn....

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe!”
Reviews.Author: suzette54
Reviews.Content: I joined a Monograms tour group staying there for 3 nights after arriving from Florence. Handy location next to the train station. Room was fine, free internet. First night there, the fire alarms went off at 9 pm and the hotel smelled of burning wiring. We waited in the lobby while the firemen checked things out. Got ok to return to rooms about 10. At 11, we were woken to shouts in the hallways of "everybody out, everybody out". Threw on clothes and rushed down 3 flights of stairs, and outside... the hotel was full of smoke. We stood outside until after 3 a.m., when firemen escorted us one by one to our rooms in the dark, up the stairs, to retrieve our belongings by flashlight. It was cold, and they finally brought us sheets to wrap up in. At 4 a.m., I was moved to a hotel off the island, away from Venice. The next day at 1 pm, the tour company moved me back to a Venice hotel. The whole experience was horrible and frightening. Later, I googled Bellini fire, and got other reports of the fire alarms going off and the electricity going off at this hotel during the past year. I think they have a SERIOUS safety problem, and you couldn't pay me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay after our cruise”
Reviews.Author: Kokolojo
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here on the advice of our travel agent and we were extremely pleased with her selection. We stayed here for one night after a 10 day Med. Cruise and it was the perfect place. Easy to get to from the pier( a short ride on the "PeopleMover") and short walk from the Piazzale Roma. We checked in early, the rooms weren't ready but the staff stored our luggage and was already delivered when we arrived back to the room. Service was very friendly and our rooms were spacious and clean. We had 2 rooms on the second floor in the quiet part of the hotel. It was a little warm in the room when we arrived, however, we opened the windows to a wonderful evening breeze. The buffet breakfast was good. The vaporettos were very accessible. It's not close to St. Marks square but everything is within walking distance. Liked best: the beautiful chandeliers, liked least: leaving so early...will return and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad review proves totally wrong for us”
Reviews.Author: artmonger
Reviews.Content: I read a review posted on the 26th of February which was so damning of this hotel that I was really anxious about my stay. I can happily say that my fears were totally unfounded. We had a lovely room on the fifth floor, clean large and welcoming; giving on to a terrace which we virtually had to ourselves affording a view of the canal and hurly-burly below from which we were wonderfully aloof. Ok the lifts were a little eccentric, the breakfast not A1 but fine enough - on the other hand all the staff very helpful. So if you want to be near to the station and Ferrovia which saves hauling luggage around then I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but A/C didn't work well (never really does in Europe)”
Reviews.Author: tintedkia
Reviews.Content: Great location near train station (who wants to be in central Venice anyway, too loud and touristy). Easy to get to from the bus from the airport. The room was nice and the bathroom was recently remodeled with hot hot water and a towel warmer. The A/C didn't work well (which is typical in Europe). We were forced to open the windows which let multiple mosquitoes in. The pigeons were also rather loud at times. All in all, good hotel. I'm not sure there is much better in Venice. The A/C, mosquito and pigeon issues will be prevalent in all areas of the city. Free wi-fi which the staff say isn't available in the rooms, but it is if you're on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near the train station.”
Reviews.Author: ChantelAdcock
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel we stayed in on our tour of Italy that met our American standards. Large room with nice furnishings. Large bath room with full size shower/tub. Fantastic breakfast buffet with large selection.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss--NOT 4-star by any stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: Rob187871
Reviews.Content: I often use Tripadvisor to find places to stay, but this is the first time I have felt motivated to sign up and give my own opinion. Now, I understand that sometimes things just don't go to plan, even in the best-run hotels. I consider myself a relaxed hotel guest. I had never complained about a hotel before before my stay at the Boscolo Bellini. That said, I was very disappointed in the Boscolo Bellini. I advise anyone thinking of staying there to go elsewhere. There are much better hotels in Venice that are available for much less money. 1) There was a smell from my bathroom so bad that I began gagging and retching when I opened the door. Anyone who has a septic tank that needs to be opened and drained regularly will know the kind of open-sewer smell I'm talking about. A hotel worker arrived to turn down my bed and she began gagging. I called reception and asked to be moved. The receptionist said that there was no smell and told me that it would be impossible to move me. Because my reservation was for two nights, I asked to cancel the second night for a refund so that I could find a room elsewhere. That was also refused. 2) The hotel advertises wireless internet, but this is only available IN the reception area--which is full of people most of the time (no seats, very loud, people looking at your screen!). Internet is not available in rooms. I called the hotel before making a reservation to check that there would be wireless in my room because I need it for work. I was told there would be. 3) On the second night of my stay, a fire alarm went off for over three hours starting at midnight. That is not an exaggeration or a mistake; I said three hours. According to the receptionist, it goes off whenever anyone smokes in their room. The receptionists can't turn it off for some reason and need to wait for a technician to arrive from outside the hotel. Another guest, who had been staying at the hotel for a week, told me that the same thing had happened on two previous nights during his stay. This alarm was so loud that I could not hear the phone ring and I could not have a conversation anywhere inside the hotel. It was just awful. The lack of sleep and my tiredness made my stay in Venice not much fun. 4) I ordered room service for breakfast on the first morning of my stay. It cost about 30 Euros for scrambled eggs, coffee, and bread rolls. All of these items were cold when they arrived. The coffee tasted very strange and it was undrinkable. The rolls were clearly stale. 5) Not that big of a deal for me--as long as I can sleep and the room is clean, I'm usually happy. But others expecting a four-star experience may want to know that the decor in my room was pretty sad. The carpet was dirty and threadbare, everything was scuffed and faded, there was a strong smell of mold. There was disgusting crud all over the walls of my bathroom, and like I said, the smell in there was unbelievable. I had to sleep with the windows wide open (in winter) and my coat on. Not a fun stay. I find in Italian hotels that rooms for single guests are often a lot worse than the doubles, and usually I'm not that bothered by it. But in this hotel, it was pretty bad. I had friends (a couple) staying in another room and theirs was MUCH better than mine. 6) I complained for the first time in my life to the manager about my stay--particularly the alarm situation. Other guests were doing the same thing. She told us, "I will explain." Her explanation was that their fire alarm system is what it is and can't be changed. She said that we should feel sorry for the receptionist who has to deal with customer complaints every time the alarm starts going off--a frequent occurrence, apparently! She said that the smell problem is an ongoing problem at the hotel, and that customers are always moved. I told her that I was not moved even though I asked three time, and that the smell was so bad FOR MY ENTIRE STAY that I and a hotel staff member were dry retching because of it. She said that I must not have wanted to be moved. She said that there is wireless internet at the hotel. I told her that I had been told there was internet in the rooms. She said I was lying. I gave up. This experience at the hotel really ruined my trip to Venice. Summary: this was in no way a four-star experience. It was just one problem after another. The attitude of the manager was incredibly bad and unhelpful. I strongly advise everyone to stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem at the best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LesTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Boscolo Bellini hotel. This splendid hotel is located seconds away from Santa Lucia train station in Venice. Go left when you leave the station. The hotel is less than 500 feet away, on the left side of the street (almost in front of the bridge). Rooms are super clean and tidy. Great breakfast. Staff is professional and efficient. Always ready to help and assist. I have to commend Angela (a senior staff member) who went out of her way to help in every possible way. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “LOved it”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum6d9
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is great, close to the train station. the rooms were kind of small, however what was the main selling point of this hotel is the rooftop patio that was over looking the whole of Venice. the bathrooms were a lot bigger with a full tub. service was great, and we lover it. they had free internet and breakfast, which is always a big plus. the hotel is small however nothing in Venice is too big, because there is just no space.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station and water bus!”
Reviews.Author: Choppy1102
Reviews.Content: The hotel was alright cleanliness wise. We had a modern room but view of an alley. Location was great, very close to train station (literally 1 min away) and steps away from the water bus. It's a far walk to St Marks square so you will need to take a water bus. Staff quoted us 8 euros for breakfast but then we were charged 15...breakfast was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPapa
Reviews.Content: First, the location is near the train station (five min walk) and the Ferrovia vaporetto stop on the canal is near the front of the hotel. Water taxis are available there too. It is some distance walk across the Rialto bridge to St. Marks but no problem in the day. Vaporetto (water bus) travel is no problem anytime they operate and they are a lot of fun. This is trip five. I enjoy walking in the late evenings and early morning. I feel safe anywhere in Venice but still get lost. This is not an area I would want to be lost at night. The area also has a more commercial run down feel about it. I prefer staying near St. Marks, but if proximity to transportation connections are more important â€¦. A modern Santiago Calatrava designed land bridge finished in 2008 is located near the train station and connects the city to land bus and auto travel. The hotel: We saw both good and bad rooms at the Bellini. The bad: our first room was smaller than we expected. The bathroom had no window and was not vented allowing mold build up on the ceiling and upper walls and blackened grout in the shower. We stayed one night and reported this issue. The desk clerk asked that we pack our bags and hotel staff moved us to another room. Our new room was closer to the canal and may have been recently updated. The bathroom was clean and vented. The bedroom room area seemed slightly larger and was better organized. No issues with this room. We found the Bellini staff to be attentive, helpful and intelligent but have an issue with management on the mold which should have been detected and corrected before our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but plumbing problems spoiled our visit.”
Reviews.Author: NorthBayBabs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located just over the bridge from the train station. The hotel lobby is attractive and the desk personel were pleasant upon our arrival. The room was huge and we had a great terrace from which you could see the Grand Canal and many church spires and bell towers. I was delighted with the marble bathroom and the big soaker tub. The trouble started the first night when I had a bath. The water drained all over the floor and actually came up through the tiles. We mopped it up as best we could with towels but it continued to seep onto the floor all night making the marble floors very slippery. We spoke to the desk in the morning and were assured that it would be looked at. The next night the same thing happened. When we were checking out we confronted the desk personel about this problem and suggested some compensation for our problems and were told that was not their policy. We paid $288. per night CD for two nights so our stay was not inexpensive and we felt some form of compensation would have been a good will gesture. Northbay Babs

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: kimk76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance to the train station, piazzale roma, cruise port (via tram/bus) and vaporetto (ferrovia stop). It's about a 30 minute walk to San Marco. The free wifi in the lobby did not work. The bathroom has a bad musty smell and tub has poor drainage. The walls are extremely thin. I was in a room on the alley side and you can hear people as they walked and conversed. It was really hard to sleep. Requested a wake up call and did not get it. There are few selections on the TV to watch and none for English speakers. The location was great for easy access to public transportation, but I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: globet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October, Great location near station, water bus, lots of restaurant etc, room was a little dated. clean and comfy, didn't have English channel on tv, not a major problem but nice to know whats going on in the world outside. breakfast was continental which was fine. you need to be up early to get croissants. Only bad luck was we were woken on two morning by housekeeping staff getting mixed up on what rooms they should be in.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronin28
Reviews.Content: I would consider this hotel moderate by all standards, which is more than what you expect in Venice. As most of the hotels in the area, it is small and old. View is nothing to speak of, but who wants to stay indoors in Venice. No English channels on T.V., again we're not there to watch T.V. Free internet though. Location of hotel is excellent, right next door to the train station. Close to many shops and restaurants. Excellent breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: prawncracker
Reviews.Content: For our purposes - i.e. a hotel in a great location, comfortable rooms, nice staff, and an absolutely fabulous price (I've paid more per night for a drab Edinburgh hotel room) I can't fault the Boscolo Bellini. Our room was large, the bed was enormous and soft, the bathroom was luxurious (to me anyway). I don't think our TV had any English channels on it but who is watching TV in Venice? No idea about coaxial cables mentioned below. We used free WIFI a few times but connection wasn't great. None of this affected my Venice holiday which was amazing. And it was great knowing we had such a nice hotel room to go back to. I hadn't slept so well in months. Loved the huge Murano glass chandeliers everywhere. We'd stayed in Bellagio the week before, in a really lovely hotel, but room tiny in comparison and twice the price (astounding view though, lovely accomodating staff and amazing food, Hotel Silvio if you are interested). We had a rooftop view in the Boscolo, nothing special, but really, with amazing things to see and do all around you in Venice who is staying in their hotel room long enough to worry? It was a great base, right next to the station - after our long train journey from Lake Como I was glad of that. Lista di Spagna is very busy - but a very short walk away are the quieter backstreets and lovely restaurants. Buffet breakfast was great. I would book this hotel again without a thought. I thought it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: catmagda44
Reviews.Content: stayed here as part of a bus trip of italy. i expect small old hotels but this hotel took it to the next level. no tv as the last tenant had stolen the coaxe cable.. thew phone was broken and unable to be fixed. (we needed a wake up call the next day as part of our bus trip as was told someone would knock on our door. 0 surprisingly they did? also the level of mould in the bathroom was so bad my teenage daughter refused to shower in there and risk her health.. venice is so beautiful and there is more than enough great establishments to use than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four star - they're dreaming”
Reviews.Author: farpavilions
Reviews.Content: A broken fridge, supporting a tv with no English speaking station, no mini bar, no power points, no coffee/tea facilities and then no lift for two of the three days we were there. Apathetic staff, and dreadful 'American' breakfast. A coke or water from the mini bar list dsiplayed in the room - 6 Euro !(but no mini bar). No internet facilities either.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: realnanny
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed here for two nights. It was great. Only a few feet from the rail station, right on the canal and accross from a bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Quality -- Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: WLanzet
Reviews.Content: Bellini is, at best, a two-star hotel! We reserved a superior deluxe room and were assigned #209 right next to the elevator The room was small, even by European standards. The elevator made noise throughout the night/morning, the A/C leaked dripping water by the door, and when it rained there was wet carpet by the window. The musty stench throughout the room was awful! The shower couldnâ€™t be regulated between hot-cold. No Internet access was available. Three times we asked the front desk for assistance and they did nothing to make things right. According to the desk personnel, not once during our three-night stay was a manager ever on duty to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: WheretoNextNewYork
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights here and couldn't have been happier. We were upgraded to a superior room with a balcony and Grand Canal view and though on the first floor once the drapes and windows were closed noise was never an issue. Indeed our first day after arriving we slept until 10:15. Staff was helpful making dinner reservations. The bed was excellent and the room and hotel was spotless. The rooftop deck was lovely. Full breakfast was also excellent. The location is perfect - a 2 minute walk from the Santa Lucia train station makes it easy for day trips as well as check in if ariving by train. Also, 2 minute walk form the vaparetto stop mkaes for easy access to all of Venice. If arriving from the airport from Piazale Roma simply jump on the vaporetto - and go one stop to Ferrovia - take a left and just past the train station on your left you will see the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for fantastic location and good hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: smotley
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel because of the location and I was nervous about it as reviews as always are mixed and Rick Steves in his guidebook recommends AGAINST this neighborhood. I could not DISAGREE more! First, the locaiton near the train station is ideal if like us you are picking up a rental car as you leave Venice for the rest of your vacation. It is an easy walk with your bag to the rental car pickup location just slightly behind the train station. I did not find it to be noisy. It is also a great locaiton because you don't have to worry about getting lost! If there is ONE THING that is signed fairly well in Venice and appears on every map, it is the train station. So we explored with confidence knowng we could find our way back. Third, the Vaporetto stop on the grand canal is really footsteps away from the front door! So you could take it right on down to St. Mark's or walk if you are game. The hotel itself is a little quirky but we liked it. The rooms were compact as they can be in European cities but very clean and nicely decorated. Kind of what I would imagine Venetian shabby chic to be like. We shopped around and in order to get something nicer we would have had to pay quite a bit more. So we went for it and if we return to Venice would stay here again. Just make sure that you know your preferences and what is important to you. Venice is the place where we spent the least amount of time in our hotel in our entire two week trip. Literally, we slept there and had a drink in the bar. Absolutley fine with that and the front desk staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel very near the train station - no hassles!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorMcStrat
Reviews.Content: This was the one hotel in Italy where we felt we got our money's worth. The room was very clean and well appointed. The A/C actually worked (a first for us in Italy), and the staff was gregarious and helpful. Also, it is only a short walk from the train station. It's only a two minute walk, and it save you from dragging your luggage around Venice on foot. It's a bit far from St Mark's Square, but once you see that place clogged with tourists, you'll soon grow to appreciate the locale around the Bellini. When I return to Venice, I will definitely stay at the Bellini again The Boscolo hotel chain that runs this hotel was easy to work with and actually gave us the superior room we booked in advance. I now know I can trust the Boscolo name as we used them in Florence as well with the same result. The Bellini isn't the fanciest hotel in Venice, but it was well worth the cost and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Nicc40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boscollo for the night before and after a cruise. The rooms were excellent, especially 102 overlooking the Grand Canal. The hotel was so convenient for the water bus and water taxi which were outside the door and wasnt far from the station where the airport buses drop off. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. The staff , especially Daria, were helpful and knowledgeable. I would recommend and certainly plan to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want sleep! Plush, good location, but a bit run down and lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Brindabellaboy
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you want sleep! The church outside our window went nuts with its bells early every morning waking us up, so forget enjoying the night life in Venice. Room was very nice and great location, but air conditioning was broken so we slept poorly in the heat. Non Italian TV was also broken, and the only power point was in the bathroom which in the modern age us just hopeless. WiFi is through ax third party and only works on the floor (useless) so we got a Wind SIM card for our phone from Planet Internet nearby and used that instead and it worked fine for 20 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bellini”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1702
Reviews.Content: this hotel was right down the way from the train station. we walked there with all our luggage. it felt very fancy. i enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “great location but beware of room 502”
Reviews.Author: terohare
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel early as we had just come of a cruise. Checked in at 9am but advised we couldn't check in til 1.30. So they secured our luggage and we were left to wander aound this lovely city. On returning to the hotel we were taken in the tiny lifts to our room 504. This was pretty awful, old carpet, bed cover and furniture. I was less than impressed with the room, which was an attic room and the skylight windows were damp stained the window above the bed didnt have a blind. The overal appearance was shabby and looked as if it was maybe staff quarters. Going back to reception we complained about the room, and were immediately changed into room 123. This was a lovely room and more in keeping with general expectations of a 4* hotel. This room in the only room in the hotel with its own terrace, so a nice touch in a city location. Breakfasts were average bacon, scrambled eggs, cereals, breads etc. It is an ideal location near to the bus station and outside the door is a ferry drop off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sweet little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeavenAF
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was so fantastic, directly next to P. Roma, the train station, and a water taxi drop off, it was absolutely perfect. The hotel was cute, and we enjoyed our stay there. We had a little leak in the room that made the carpet wet but it wasn't a very big deal. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bed was nice and the room was quiet and clean. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicundo
Reviews.Content: I went for my 30th Birthday to Venice and chose the Boscolo Belline based on the reviews. I was so happy when i arrived as its everything i expected. I could not fault one thing! Staff extremley friendy, rooms very comfortable. We somehow managed to get ( i think) the best room in the hotel! Room 198, it has its very own gorgeous little couryard that no one else seems to use!! it was so so peaceful as it was set at the back of the hotel. It was right by the bus and train station so really easy to find, a water stop right outside the door of the hotel, it was quite far from St Marco, however that did not bother us too much as we try to avoid loads of tourists and it was also a lot cheaper to eat where the hotel is as its a bit further out. We have a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel to others :-)

Reviews.Title: “What's with the shower? Perfect hotel location though.”
Reviews.Author: RockinJim
Reviews.Content: Ok, let's start with the shower, because there's so much to say about it. The first morning there I went in and turned the shower on. I looked around for the foot towel to place in front of the shower but I couldn't find it, so I grabbed another towel and placed it in front of the shower. Around 30 seconds after turning the water on I could hear the shower filling up with water so I checked to see why it wasn't draining, and I found the foot towel on the bottom of the shower, blocking the drain. Apparently this is where they place the foot towel at this hotel, instead of hanging on the shower door or rack outside the shower like every other hotel. Since I didn't have my contacts in I couldn't notice the white foot towel lying against the white shower floor (see picture). Once I got the shower drained I turned the water back on and started showering, only to notice the shower had a very slow drain, so I had to turn the water down to a slow drizzle in order to finish my shower. There is no where in the shower to put your soap or shampoo except on the floot (see picture), and because the shower was so small, it made it extremely difficult to bend down to get those items. Be careful though moving around in the shower because of the very tight quarters it's very easy to bump the handle to turn the water off. And why didn't they put the shower door on so it would open the other way without having to step over and around the toilet to get into the shower? (see picture) Well the shower is annoying, but enough with it for now because the hotel is in the perfect location.
