It's probably only around 300 yards from the car/bus drop off location and only 100 yards or so from the train station, which makes it really easy to walk to your hotel, even with luggage. It sits right on the Grand Canal and is surrounded by lots of shops, restaurants, atm's, etc. We took a boat out to Burano island which was great, which I would highly recommend. You can google it to learn all about their brightly colored houses there. We also bought some of the famous glassware they produce on the island of Murano. The breakfasts were good at the hotel, and the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. The WiFi Internet is free in the lobby. The beds weren't great but were ok. And beware the pigeons outside the window that like to start making noise at the crack of dawn. Most annoyances were minor, and were far overshadowed by the excellent location, free WiFi, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just as a 4-star hotel should be - perfect at this level”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: Arriving very late in the evening after a long day of train travel, we were greeted with friendliness and efficiency. All we wanted to do was get into the room and rest and the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. The room was elegant, normal size for a city hotel in Italy, nicely furnished in an antique style, with what proved to be a comfortable, firm king size bed with good quality bed linen. The bathroom was nicely laid out, good toiletries and large thick bathsheets (although the hand- and bidet towels were linen). Our view was over rooftops, i.e. no view at all, but it meant we were undisturbed by street noise. Breakfast was very good - a good selection of cold meats and cheeses, plus cereals & yoghurt . Scrambled eggs & bacon were also available each day - this didn't change. Coffee from a self-serve machine was also good. Proved to be difficult to get good bread in Venice but the croissants were OK. We had chosen the hotel for its proximity to the railway station and were pleased to find that it meant no schlepping of suitcases over bridges and getting lost down narrow alleyways as can sometimes be the case in Venice. While the Lista di Spagna is quite a "touristy" street with cheap pizza places and souvenirs, there were some nice bars and restaurants close by too. It also proved an ideal starting point for catching the vaporetti to just about everywhere... although these were invariably very, very crowded. All in all, top marks to the hotel - one we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get the room type you paid for, avoid room 115.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAndEmma2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May 2010, we booked a superior room having looked on the website.... when we checked in we were given room 115. The bedroom was ok but the bathroom was, in my opinion, dangerous. The bath was dirty - the pull cord in the bath was meant to be white but was black and grouting around the tiles was possibly mouldy. The worst thing for me though was that part of the bath had chiped away and was rusty, this was not fit for guests. When we asked at reception we were 'upgraded' to a much better room a 'superior' - despite this is what we had originally booked. Other guests we spoke to said the same happened to them! Apart from the service at reception on arrival- the second room was ok, it was clean and the bathroom was clean. We didn't pay the 15Euro each for breakfast - instead we choose the supermarket at Pia. Roma Boat stop (next to the bank).

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel if you want to be sure to have a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: taiitravel
Reviews.Content: I booked 12 rooms for a group for June 2 - 6 2010. Well the hotel is WAY overbooked and the hotel put them in a hotel far far away and no monetary compensation. My group is not the only one with problems at this hotel. I WILL NEVER USE BOSCOLO AGAIN. Doubtful management will answer because they do not answer faxed questions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJGriffUk
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Venice at the beginning of May. We arrived in Venice to terrible rain from the train. The hotel is situated 2mins from the train station and from the reception area you can see the grand canal. Our room was on the 5th floor and towards the back of the hotel so we had views over the roof tops of Venice and could see St. Marks Square. The room was not very big but was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was lovely and has a very nice bath and powerful shower. We had a slight problem with the shower leaking but when reported the staff were straight up to help and provide additional towels. The staff were very helpful and spoke very good English. When we checked in we were provided with a map showing Venice and how to get from the hotel to St. Marks Square. I would recommend the hotel to anybody but am unsure about Venice as a destination for a break.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Gobbo85
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at Hotel Bellini with my partner and it was fantastic. We arrived quite a while before the official check-in time but we were checked in by a very friendly receptionist and our bags were taken by an equally friendly porter, as we couldnâ€™t go up to our room until after 1pm. The room we were given was lovely with a fabulous view of the Grand Canal but unfortunately the bathroom had a drainage problem and the smell was far from pleasant. We complained about the smell and were immediately given the choice of two different rooms with even better views! I was extremely happy with this and a member of staff came to help with our luggage once we were ready to move. Housekeeping also come round in the evening to turn the bed covers down and draw the curtains which I thought was a very nice touch. Breakfast was great too. Plenty of everything, even late on as after all the walking we had done it was a struggle getting up early for breakfast. There was a good selection of meats, cheeses, bread and even bacon and eggs if you fancied something hot. The location is fabulous. It is right next to the train station, a 5 minute walk to the bus station at Piazzale Roma and the Ferrovia water stops are directly outside the hotel. Thus, if you do get lost wandering around the back streets follow the yellow signs for 'Alla Ferrovia' and you will find your way home! Overall I loved our stay here. The location is fantastic and the hotel is very easy to find. All the staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the hotel itself is lovely. I would definitely stay here again and recommend Hotel Bellini to friends.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ArkadiuszW
Reviews.Content: 1st and most important fantastic location - 1 min walk from train station and max 5 from bus station - very easy to find - walking distance to all most important places in Venice- very friendly staff, very clean room 215 and nice bathroom, can not expect amazing view on canal if you are in basic room , but be honest everywhere if you want room with amazing view you need to pay a lot of extra- which is fair enough - here is not necessary to do it coz all day we spend outside and coming back late at night. 1 minus - no WIFI in the room ( available only on tv. hotel definitely to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near train station and grand canal”
Reviews.Author: rgehring
Reviews.Content: Perfect location!!! Just perfect. Couldn't be better situated for someone arriving by train, which is the only way to visit Venice. Loved this place, loved the town. Our room had private deck, was tiny, but great bathroom. Couldn't have been happier save for the smallness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed, and nice American breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel with a 4-star rating is owned by Boscolo. It is at the begining of Lista De Spagna street, near the train station and with the vaporetto bus 42 stop, the line that goes to Murao, about 20 steps from the hotel entrance. The room is richly furnished with warm tones and has very comfortable latex foam type of bed. The American breakfast fuffet has better bacon than the fatty ones on the NCL GEM cruise ship. A few doors down is the cafetaria style Brek restaurant with a cook to order grill, pasta station and salad bar; there is no cover or service charge. A couple more stores down, all on the same side of the street is the Quanto Basta pizza joint where a Maxi (18"?) thin crust marinara pizza (no cheese) sells for 7.5 Euro, others cost 8.5 Euro or higher. I would rate this hotel higher than Santa Marina, which has an annex building. The only negative for Bellini is it has no Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Volcanic Ash rip off by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BilloEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel took advantage of some destitute friends who were stranded due to the European flight cancellations. Instead of a 100 to 120E usual rate they quoted 400E A NIGHT! Fortunately I have business contacts in Venice who swiftly moved them to another hotel for 86E per night. I also mailed this hotel a couple of times pointing out that I ,up to 10 friends and other business contacts of mine and some venetians recommend and use this hotel. THEY IGNORED THESE MAILS --how stupid as this will cost them many 000s of Euros over the next couple of years.... What was not a surprise was that Easy Jet had no representation at Marco Polo airport to guide their customers and whenever they got through to them on the phone --they were cut off before they could speak. The Hotel attitude was a huge shock though..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: gaesedun
Reviews.Content: 4 Star? Value for money Hotel, great location clean rooms although a little tired, typical continental breakfast, quite a good selection. Staff very helpful at all time, would have no problem returning to this Hotel. And they did have a problem with a water leak while we were there but this did not effect us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamilleriMalta
Reviews.Content: My family and I spend 5 days at the Boscolo Bellini hotel. Location good but it's defintely not a 4 star hotel. Altthough we had booked a luxury room, we were given a room overlooking roofs. Although it was advertised that there was internet in the rooms, belief it or not but the receptionist tried to convince us that all the wires got wet that's why it wasn't working. Breakfast, although it was a buffet but when an item finished they didn't replace it, we had to ask for a replacement. and then they get out just a small portion (just to shut us up). We've been in other Boscolo Hotels but this one is defintely not one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in ideal location to see all Venice”
Reviews.Author: EssexJill
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the Grand Canal and opposite the Ferrovia (station) vaporetto stop the Boscolo Bellini Hotel is perfectly situated to explore this delightful city. It's also only a short walk from the bus station which is a great way to get into Venice from Marco Polo airport (only 3 euros). The hotel staff were very welcoming and couldn't have been more helpful throughout our 3 day stay. Our double standard room was huge with typically Venetian interior and lovely large bathroom. There was a mini bar, TV, hairdryer and all amenities. Breakfast was served in the large dining room with plenty of choice to set you up for a busy day's sight-seeing. We ambled through the streets to get to wherever we wanted to go and generally caught the water bus back in the early evening. There are plenty of restaurants ion the area although don't expect to find much other than pizza and pasta! The price was excellent value for this 4 star hotel. Higly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aneldebruyn
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location - close to the train station, and well known amongst vaporetto operators, so we never had any difficulty getting back there after a day out. Service was good enough, although my emails enquiring about room location were not answered. Breakfast was absolutely inedible (powder eggs, stale bread and croissants, rubbery cheese and burnt coffee), but then it's difficult to find anywhere decent to eat in Venice on the whole. The room was fine - quiet and clean. The heating is unstoppable, but being there in winter, this is not a bad thing. I wouldn't want to stay there in the summer. Seeing as this is only the second hotel I stayed in in Venice, I will be looking around for another one or two before completely writing this one off, but I will definitely not bank on breakfast there again.

Reviews.Title: “we have been robbed from the room safe of the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FendyQUebec
Reviews.Content: The room was ok; breakfast was poor, what comes with it: part of our money was stolen from the room safe. When we complained to the management, they completely denied the possibility of such an act, and later on we discovered this is common, and happened to many others. They do not take the whole content of the safe, just part of your money , and they persuade you made the mistake â€¦ in case you discover something is missing

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no regret !!”
Reviews.Author: samwong
Reviews.Content: Located just beside Venice St.Lucia Train Station. From the train station main entrance (there is only 1 entrance basically), go down the stairs and turn to your left. Within 1-2 mins, you will see it. See, how convenience it is !!

Reviews.Title: “The Bellini was fine”
Reviews.Author: satisfied-visitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a pal for a few days last week. The hotel was easy to find from the airport and I thought well located for everything. The hotel was clean, comfortable and our room - 202 - had great views from the balcony over the front and the canal. The breakfast was perfectly acceptable - hot and cold choices of food to suit most tastes and plenty of it. I would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: Fiat
Reviews.Content: Since we stayed 14 nights and wanted to use the train daily to see various areas of the Veneto region, the location in relation to the railroad station and Piazzale di Roma could not be any better. The problem was poor location of the room (overlooking rooftops and a garbage can in the rear of the hotel). Since the tub was old, clogged, and moldy, we had to complain on a daily basis for three days. They finally changed our room (same view but considered by the staff a free upgrade). The bathroom was clean & the shower stall was great. Ventilation, however, was extremely poor -- no window and a vent that was inoperative, making the area steamy after showers and smelly during high tide. Because the bedroom was very hot and the temperature could not be controlled, we were advised to open the windows and sleep over the covers. The result was a room full of mosquitoes and faces that resembled recovery from measles due to the bites. The refrigerator generated heat rather than cold; therefore, it was useless as a refrigerator.You would think that the staff of an expensive "four-star" hotel would be more considerate of a couple who stayed there 14 nights. Breakfast items were seldom replenished -- not matter how early or late one arrived. Eggs were always scrambled and made from powdered eggs. Orange juice was orange in name and color only. All drinks were from an automated machine; the fault did not lie with the staff. The dining area simply was uderstaffed and overworked since it had to deal with tour groups. Having said all of this, we would still recoomend it to a friend because of its location. Restaurants in the area leave a lot to be desired, unless one goes to expensive ones. Two that we would recommend are Pontini Trattoria and Bar near the bridge that leads to the Jewish Quarter and Pedrocchi on Piazza S. Geramia (the Church of S. Geramia contains the body of Saint Lucy). For those who have a long stay in Venice, we reccommend day-train-trips to Vicenza, Cividale di Friule, Bassano del Grappa, Asolo, Feltre, and Padova(only if you want to visit the Santuary of Saint Anthony). This was our 73rd trip abroad (50-some in Italy and six in Venice); therefore, we have a lot of travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice base location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter3545
Reviews.Content: 5 days in Venice really saw the sights Bellini is Only steps from the train station and no bridges to lug yor bags over or $$$ taxies to get in to your hotel. we where off the train and checked in within 15 minutes. Great staff at the front desk very helpfull on maps and the best Gellato. we where back out the door and getting lost in Venice within the half hour. One of the four bridges over the Grand Canal outside the door make getting around easy. and another bonus was getting home was a cinch as all we had to do was follow the signs on any corner to the train station. Our first room had a peak a boo view of the Grand Canal but the kitchen vent blew out direclty at our window and the smell was bad Avoid rooms 420 , 419 and 418. we asked for a change and were moved right away with apologies. Cons - limited heating control in the rooms. It had turned cool for a few days so the main boiler was on. the problem was it turned warm again (second Spring) and the rooms were very hot at night. Windows can open but the biting bugs would drain the blood out of you in a night so not an option. obviously not a cronic problem as it was an unusually warm spell (it was wonderful) Had breakfast one day in the dining room quite good but we prefered to find a bar and have cappo and crousant out on the street. great place

Reviews.Title: “location is key”
Reviews.Author: gmmiami1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed with Bellini recently for 2 nights. Absolutely beautiful hotel. Staff was great at front desk, concierge, the bar and even the cleaning staff when I interacted.. At first I thought I was getting a great rate/deal as I would be outside "the action"...as it is situated near the train station right on the Grand Canal. I couldn't have been more wrong. Yes it wasn't on St. Marks Square but for that I'm happy. It was a great location to get started and to end my siteseeing each day. There was major crossing, and a boat (taxi, bus, and gondola) stop just in front. The places to eat and shop in the area were great and I would say slightly less expensive; although Venice is significanlty more expensive than any place el;se you might visit in Italy. I would recommend this hotel as a bargain without cutting corners in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: JonandLaura
Reviews.Content: Location is right around the corner from the train station. Easy walking with suitcase! Rooms are large, comfy, quiet, and elegant. Staff okay. Very quiet rooms. Breakfast ok. Loved the courtyard. Loved the beauty of this place. We were at this hotel as it is part of the Monograms Tour package. Otherwise, probably couldn't afford it. For those of you who can, by all means, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no internet connection!”
Reviews.Author: victorsh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and clean, and considering its right next to the ferry and train station, the location can't be beat. Only wish it had internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “The shabby chic faded glory of Venice”
Reviews.Author: geeka
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was in old historic Venice, it was cheap and looked ok! It is also near the station, which is great as a landmark when you get lost (as you will do in Venice). The website looks swankier than the hotel actually is. However, for about Â£50 a night each, including breakfast, for a double room we could not have asked for better. The bed(s) were extremely comfy and very clean, and the service from the staff was excellent. If you think of the decor being the sort of faded glory of Venice, then it seems an absolutely fine hotel! There was oodles of hot water, and a good bath in our ensuite. We will definitely go back. The breakfasts were also delicious. There was loads of choice and you could have as much or as little as you liked, the only tiny complaint I would have would be that the coffee was out of a machine (we are in Venice - come on!!) and there was a slight odd smell in the bathroom. Who cares - go out for a coffee and open the bathroom window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: SpritzLondon
Reviews.Content: Must be the only hotel in the world that doesn't have any internet access for its guests - they send you to an internet cafe down the road! Isn't that a prerequisite of all hotels these days? The location (station, Grand Canal, vaporetto stops on the doorstep) is excellent. Rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable. With one or two exceptions, the staff need some lessons in smiling and customer awareness. And the breakfast is very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Walking Distance Location to Train Station and Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: pstrode
Reviews.Content: 300 yards from the train station, we walked to the Boscolo Hotel Bellini, right along the grand canal. Reasonably comfortable. No free wireless internet in room. Convenient for walking but far from San Marco unless take waterbus which stops just up the street, which is worth the small cost and the remarkable view.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: jackyboywisconsin
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing going for this hotel. The location. It's only about 100 yards from the train station. This was great for us. We arrived by train in the pouring rain. It was a quick dash to the hotel. While the hotel has 4 stars I'm at a loss to know how they got them. The place has certainly seen better days. The carpeting, wall paper, and furnishings are worn, dirty and stained. The staff was rude and indifferent. Also don't go to the restaurant that is straight out the front door. It's a total ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonSam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 3 minutes walk from the train station, so if travelling by train it is ideal, it is also very near the boat buses as well as within shops and bars nearby. The cafe next door served good meals at a reasonable price. You can walk to St Marks Square in about 20 minutes. The room was a good size and very quiet. The breakfast was very basic but normal for Italy. We travelled overnight from Paris to Venice on the sleeper train, which is one thing I would not recommend, its very cramp and noisy, so personally would rather stop over somewhere half way rather than do that, as we arrived there tired

Reviews.Title: “Venitian Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ratchet44
Reviews.Content: Lcoation, Location, Location The hotel claims to be located on the Grand Canal in the heart of Venice, walking distance from Saint Marks Square but in reality is set back from the Canal and not visable from the rooms. The hotel is actually a few hundred yards from the busy train station. We walked to St Marks Square the first day and it took almost two hours thru the winding streets of Venice. The other option is to take the Varaperretto Water Taxi but even that takes 45 minutes and costs $6.50 Euros each way. To make matters worse the hotel is located next to a church and the bells ring promptly and at least 50 times at 7am each day. We found the hotel staff to be unfriendly and unhelpful and the rooms less than clean. There was no tissues, an empty water bottle under the dresser and remnants from past guests under the mattress. We ran out of towels and attempted to get replacements in the evening but were told we needed to wait until the next morning. There are plenty of other hotel options in Venice that I would suggest before you settle for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: dfloyd98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bellini for one night this September. We were supposed to stay two nights but there was a problem at the hotel and they had to move us down the street to another hotel. The hotel service was great, they booked our room at the other hotel and took our bags to the new hotel for us. The next night they upgraded us to a suite for the inconvenience they'd caused us the previous night. The room was clean and comfortable and hotels location is great. The only thing to be aware of is that there is a church next door who's bells start ringing at 7:15 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great situation”
Reviews.Author: kejori
Reviews.Content: Smart hotel at northern end of the Grand Canal, opposite the old stone bridge. The new metal bridge over the Grand Canal is a couple of hundred yards away. Bedrooms are on small side but adequate and clean. Bed in our room was very comfortable. There are at least two room types Classic and Deluxe, Deluxe gets you a canal view, a bit noisy with the window open but plenty of atmosphere from the cafes and shops below. Situated almost next to railway station and few hundred yards from bus station, vaporetto stop outside. Great for travel connections to and from city. Get yellow number 5 ACTV bus from outside Marco Polo airport arrivals straight to the bus station for 2.5 euros, then cross over new metal bridge and walk past the railway staation to the hotel. Be aware that you are supposed to pay (3.5 euros) for the small bottles of water that appear in your room fridge each morning. Only English language TV channel is CNN and occasionally Eurosport, 1 German channel, rest are in Italian. Small shop in the Lista di Spagna 100yds on the right sells bottles of wine and beer at a fraction of the price you pay in the bars and restaurants. Local Billa supermarkets are very cheap. Overall a great base for exploring the whole of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel with easy access to the Grand Canal and Train Station.”
Reviews.Author: jkmcs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. After arriving from our four nights in Israel, we took a water taxi (Stefano was great) along the Grand Canal from the airport to within a couple of hundred feet of our hotel. When checking in we were upgraded to a large, lovely room with a terrace on the top floor. Service is good especially Hani and Angela (at reception) and Julianno (bar). This is the second time we had stayed here and my son and his wife also stayed here a couple of years ago at my recommendation. With breakfast included we just went to the pleasant dining room when we awoke and then left for our self directed walking or water tours (valporettos/taxis are right outside). Last time we visited we hopped on the train and went to Florence and Rome. Remember you are in Venice and the buildings are quite old and subject to the attacks from the waters so don't expect a Hyatt or Four Seasons. This hotel stands up quite well however and its location is the best, away from the maddening crowds of tourists yet easily accessible to all Venice has to offer. We also stayed at the Boscolo owned hotel in Room which also was a great hotel. Definitely recommended. For food, other than breakfast, I would recommend the little restaurant right outside the hotel on the Grand Canal for lunch (See Giovanni) or for dinner, where we ate three times, a little gem called La Colombina in the Carnnaregio section not far from the hotel. This is an owner/chef (Domenico) run, small restaurant attracting locals and knowledgeable travellers. Service by Fabio and Donna is great and personalized. From the hotel walk out take left and go for about 1/2 mile then ask the locals. It's tucked just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bellini, Room with a View and so much more!”
Reviews.Author: OutbackLady
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the most fantastic stay at the Hotel Bellini in Venice, Italy. Our expectations on our mutual first trip to Venice were surpassed, and most especially "our" room at the Hotel Bellini. The view of the Grand Hotel from our "Deluxe" was magnificent. We could step out onto our balcony and watch all the activity below, the vaporettos (water bus), the people crossing the bridge just below, the early morning activity as the city awakes (fascinating), but more than anything have a view to kill for of the exciting architecture of Venice. The hotel is rated 4* and I believe it deserves everyone. From the Hotel Reception to the porter, nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfast featuring food for both Continental visitors and North American visitors was superb. Loved the complete peachy-brown marble of the spacious bathroom with every luxury one can think of from heated towel rails, to bath foam for the double ended bath. (Love the mountains of bath foam in the Jacuzzi made bath) And, oh yes something we have never experienced was the 'turn down' service (don't know what it's called in Italian): in the evening we would return to find our bed turned down and little freshly laundered placemats on either side fo the bed. Brilliant! Thank you to the staff at the Bellini, but especially the Hotel Receptionist. Loved the Hotel Bellini or did you notice?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: nhtigercat
Reviews.Content: My trip of a lifetime in Italy started with my stay at the Hotel Bellini. It was the perfect location right near one of the bridges in Venice. Public transportation also was easily accesible from this location. Cafe right next door. Room was roomy as well as the bathroom. Breakfast had an assortment of items such as scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, cereals and fruits as well as breads, cheeses and meats. The people at the front desk were very helpful. Just walk right out the door and you are right there to shop, stroll, and eat at an assortment of restaurants. Was air conditioned and also had elevators which some hotels do not in Italy we have found.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/Friendly Staff/Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: culturalsponge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the hub of all transportation necessary- the train station, several vaporetto lines, water taxis and buses from the airport. I was skeptical of this hotel due to it's appearance in pictures before arriving but upon arrival I was very pleased to be greeted by friendly staff who were very knowledgeable and to find our room very clean and quite Rooms: Clean, air conditioned, bright room- windows were approx 12' high and several lights, refrigerator in room, small tv but who needs tv on vacation. Be aware there is no iron in the room however, you can request your clothing to be ironed for a fee. Food: Breakfast was decent- no complaints and a bar available during the day Staff: Friendly and helpful- English speaking also Also, Bank is located across the street from the hotel- perfect for exchanging money

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice breakfast, helpful staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: n2brains
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Grand canal, easy access to everything, and near the train station. The staff was friendly and helpful, there was a complimentary minibar in the room which was nice. The rooms were lovely, a bit hot in August, but clean and comfortable. A definite good hotel to stay at in an enchanting city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bruins11
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by Boscolo Bellini. Just before our trip I read some bad reviews that spooked me but I was satisfied overall. We got a deluxe room and it came as advertised - in fact it was quite beautiful. We were lucky to get a room with a balcony and a view of the Ponte degli Scalzi and the Grand Canal (we had opted not to pay extra for the canal view.) My brother and his wife were next door and they did not have a balcony. We were on the second floor and when we closed the windows and the shutters it pretty much drowned out the noise outside (and there are hundreds of people going by this hotel even at 1am.) We would occasionally here the rumble of a vaporetto as there was a stop just in front of the hotel but it did not wake us up. The lobby of the hotel is air conditioned but the doors were often ajar for some reason (it was HOT!) I found the staff to be adequate. One of the desk clerk was polite but distant while another one was great and helped me negotiate a rate to have our bags taken by boat to the bus stop at Piazzale Roma on the day we left. The room was gorgeous with a beautiful chandelier and drapes and bedding. The shower was spacious (unlike the very small ones in other Italian cities and the head was high enough for me (6'3".) The water controls were pretty unreliable (too hot or too cold) but not enough for us to complain. We had a large tub but the water wouldn't come out of the tub's faucet (so I ran a bath by running the shower that much longer . . . ha!) We opted to take the breakfast for an additional charge. Typically this makes sense because you can fill up and then have a very light lunch. DO NOT opt for the breakfast at Boscolo Bellini. It was the worst we had of the four hotels we stayed at. There was no care put into it. The rolls were dry, the eggs, bacon, etc was just not good. The coffee was from a machine, no pots to pour, just a machine like you might find at a bus station. It allegedly produced coffee, cappuccino, & expresso but everything came out with a brown foamy residue and tasted bitter. The cereal and yogurt was not bad and most days (whether we arrived early or late) the fruit choices were paltry. We got the deluxe room w/breakfast included and used the PKST3 - Stay 3 and Save Promotion and paid $204 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location but do not believe the superior reviews”
Reviews.Author: lehigh86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the train station, car rental agencies and a stop on the the water bus which traverses the grand canal. The price point represents good value for Venice; however, the price you will pay is more than what you would expect from comparable hotels in other cities- this is the reality of high prices throughout venice. We read reviews of great air conditioning; however, our two rooms were hot, stuffy and the a/c barely worked. Our rooms were small and the furnishings were dated. The hotel reception was not overly friendly and the hotel lacked many amenities. Therefore, when selecting this hotel you must weigh location (a positive), price (a positive) and the hotel itself (a negative)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1birdie23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with a tour group. Nothing flash. Average hotel rooms. Very comfortable bed. No noise. Shower was useless. Airconditioning worked well in very hot temperatures. Great location literally next door to the train station and overlooking the Grand Canal. Breakfast average. Great Barman!

Reviews.Title: “Venice is magical!!”
Reviews.Author: wiggygail
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating..we had one small issue the second day we were there----no hot water making it to the fifth floor--but it was fixed and all was well--the cool shower was refreshing anyway after being out in the heat. Perfect location--near vaparetto and train station.Room was spacious by European standards and very clean--bathroom was large and immaculate. Bed was very comfortable and A/C worked GREAT..a rarity in Venice!!! Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!! We had a nice outdoor deck on the fifth floor from our room where we could see all directions and the Grand Canal...great views!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base to Explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: ShannonMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by the train station. You can catch a water bus just outside, or meander along the cobbled streets of Venice if you prefer. Venice is a truly amazing city, with lots to do and discover. The hotel has a great location, good breakfast, and is clean and comfortable. Excellent value for money and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definately yes”
Reviews.Author: Keryn-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Only 200m from the train station which was a real plus. Watched many people dragging their luggage up and down the many steps and bridges to and from their hotels and was glad we didn't have to. Service was great, room & bathroom was large, modern and clean. No faults.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: glassmanUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bellini is across the road from Ferrovia Vaporetto service ideal for visiting all parts of Venice. The hotel was clean and tidy offerred a variety of buffet breakfast options that seemed to suit all nations tastes. Our room was large had air conditioning and a bathroom. The bathroom was a little old fashioned but as you will see if you visit Italy the Italians never seem to get around to fixing anything until it is completely unusable. Given it position 50 mtrs or so from the Train Station (Ferrovia) on 200 mtrs from the Bus station this means that you do not have to suffer taking your cases through cobbled streets and on/off various ferries (Vaporettos) to get to/from your hotel a MAJOR advantage of this Hotel. Ideal to take a ride /stroll in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh.. Mixed Emotions”
Reviews.Author: just_crystal
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Venice train station, we were immediately frightened that we would get lost trying to locate our hotel. To our surprise, Boscolo Bellini was steps from the train station. It was very easy to locate..probably 50 steps from the station. The front desk staff were knowledable and assisted us in checking in quickly. The hotel room was pretty small. According to European standards, I would say its fairly sized. The interior looks WAY better in the photographs. It seems kind of tacky and outdated in person.. Our sheets weren't white...they seemed a bit dirty.. even when we recieved new sheets. It didnt seem like they vacuumed the room either..We didn't really mind all this because after all.. we are college students and we would only be resting there. On a brighter note, the bathroom was cute and marble. It had a full bath, bidet, toilet and sink. We were glad we didnt have to share the bathroom with other hotel guests! But let me advise you... THEY HAVE A LOT OF MOSQUITOES! Obviously, Venice is surrounded by water, but their room was swarmed with mosquitoes! We killed 5 mosquitoes the first night! And I still managed to get bit twice! For some reason, we always had them in our room. This was not fun because we hate bugs and we hate getting bit! So as a word of advice.. purchase that Off Mosquito Repellent Fan because you are definately going to need it! If I absolutely had to..I would recommend this for the budget traveler & for young singles. These select few would be able to survive the conditions because after all it IS a cheap hotel in a great location! But DO NOT TAKE YOUR SIGNIFICANT OTHER HERE! She WILL LAUGH at you..or maybe divorce you! Anywho, Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Bello Bellini”
Reviews.Author: sheth
Reviews.Content: Considering Venice Hotel, Size & Interior of the room is excellent. Even the bathroom is specious. Reception people needs to more customer friendly. One of the reception person said they have the Internet in the lobby but not working so try tomorrow morning, next morning the other person said they don't have Internet & asked to go next door Internet Cafe... Great location if you wish to stay next to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kellermeyer
Reviews.Content: Venice was our last city on a two week journey through Italy. I traveled with my husband and two children under the age of five. This was our second hotel in Venice. The first was unbearable. This was a dream. The staff was amazing. They were kind, friendly, helpful in arranging tours and giving navagation information. They remembered my children's names and said hello to them everytime we saw them. The breakfast was OK. Probably my least favorite part. Coffee was from a machine. Whatever. The location was perfect!!! Just steps from the train station. No need to navigate the buses. Drop your bags and go. The lobby was actually level with the street and a staff member took the luggage to our room. There was an elevator as well. (A novelty in Italy.) Our room was a triple. They let us look at it before committing. (We walked off of the street.) They even negotiated the price. It was a palace by comparison to every other place we stayed. It actually had two floors! It had a king sized bed upstairs. (Seriously, stairs.) Downstairs it had a twin bed and they set up a baby bed for my infant. It was air conditioned. And luxuries of all luxuries with children...it had a bathtub! No more screaming child in the small, cramped shower. My kids swam like they were in a pool. The bed was hard as a previous reviewer described. However, I challenge you to find a soft bed in the whole country. I did not. There was no internet. However, there was an internet cafe right across the street which we used. You are steps away from the vaporeto stop. Purchase a ticket and have a relaxing boat ride to any of the major sites of Venice. This is not the prettiest part of town compared to say around St. Mark's. But you don't have to thunk your bags up and down a million bridges or try to find out where you are on the labrynth of a map. It was safe, even at night, and for children. Think boardwalk without a beach or ocean. Many restauraunts and shops outside. You could walk to Rialto bridge, and we did, but it is a long walk. You are also a close ten minute walk to the bus station that takes you to the airport. Overall, it was my favorite hotel in all of Italy. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Citybreakenthusiast
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days, 2 nights, at the Boscolo Hotel Bellini in Venice with my husband and our friends. I would highly recommend this place. It is conveniently situated for pretty much everything. The staff are all friendly. The whole place is clean. The continental breakfast is perfectly adequate. We had a lovely room 210 on the 2nd floor not facing the front - very quiet, large, lovely bathroom. Our friends had room 208, slightly smaller with a smaller bathroom. Both nicely furnished and clean. There are two lifts. Opposite the hotel is a bar/restaurant on the Grand Canal, I would recommend this for drinks but the food is very expensive. I would not recommend the bar immediately next to the hotel entrance, very expensive for drinks. Over double for sitting outside! The hotel is really convenient for wandering. There is a bridge right outside which takes you over to more bars and restaurants and little pretty alleyways to wander along. The train station is within 2 minutes walk although we discovered you cannot get a train from Marco Polo airport to Venice so we caught the bus from right outside the airport = 3 euro each, perfect. That stops in Piazalli Roma and then you can walk, crossing a couple of bridges, to the hotel = 5 minutes. It's worth getting a 'hop on hop off' ticket for the vaporetti for the duration of your stay, then you can use it day or night to get around the Grand Canal and other waterways to the islands ie: Murano. Better value that way. There is a stop for the vaporetti right outside the hotel. Number 42 takes you to Murano island and the Cam Furnace shows you a working glass blowing factory and has a beautiful shop full of lovely genuine glass. When you've bought your vaporetti ticket, remember to validate it each time you use it, in the little machine at each boat stop. The ticket can also be used for most of Venice's bus services but we didn't take advantage of that. Worth catching the number 42 from the railway station to Murano and then the number 5 direct to St Marks square - superb approaching view from the boat.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: Katiecakes18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the summer and was very much looking to our stay here. The location is great but that is all the positive I can offer. The service was beyond rude, the rooms were small, and the beds were rock hard and very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottlington
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location of the hotel was great, the room (top floor) was small (not really a problem) and poorly finished. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor and the fixtures and fittings were not really fixed or fitted! Having said that, it was pretty clean and we had a small balcony. In all honesty, we only really slept in the hotel and spent most of our time out and about so as long as the beds are comfy (yes) and the room clean (yes), we're not that bothered. Ok, loads of reviews here mention the poor breakfast and I'm not going to disappoint. Breakfast really isn't that good at all. Just about adequate. For a hotel which purports to be four star it is decidely under par. If you don't mind spending a but more cash, have breakfast somewhere else. On the plus side, the service was good and the location is fab. I wouldn't go back to this hotel, but that's not to say it was *bad* - just not quite as good as I was expecting

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: wk1789
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Venice this May, booked the Hotel based on its location and magical pictures we have seen posted on the website. However when we arrived we could not believe our eyes: the rooms were so small that you could not swing a cat around, it has had a weird smell and it definetely wasn't the deluxe room that we have booked and seen on the internet. The staff could not be bothered when informed about this, it was the either this or nothing attitude. The breakfast was abysmal, sub-standard for such hotel -should have been continental not sure which continent they have meant. It did not worth the money, and definetely not recommend or would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, nice bathroom, convenient location, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: TravelingArtics
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near the train station and after reading other people's reviews, we opted to give the Hotel Boscolo Bellini a shot. It's literally less than a 5 minute walk from the train station and right next to the the bridge adjacent to the beginning of the big canal. The standard room we booked was relatively clean, a little worn-out and very small - not cozy, but cramped. There is only about two feet of space to walk around the bed, so luggage placement was an issue. After some maneuvering and moving some furniture, we were able to fit our big backpacks on the floor. At first glance, the bathroom was a complete contrast in that it looked like it was recently renovated with slightly a more modern feel, up to date and clean. However, once we used it, we found that the glass they used adjacent to the shower head in lieu of a curtain was faulty because a bunch of water leaked onto the floor during our showers, leaving us with a semi-flooded bathroom. Since we were only staying for two nights, we didn't even bother asking for another room, but we did tell the front desk about the issue upon check-out. Another issue I had was though the bathroom seemed new, it appears there is a lack of maintenance or upkeep in regards to the water damage on the ceiling. There was mold and mildew at the corner of the ceiling above the shower, which turned me off and tested my wills each time I showered not to stare at it in disgust. It served our purpose for two nights, so we have no complaint there but if you're looking for ambiance and romance, pass on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money - made me claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so unbelievably tiny - there was enough space to sidle around the bed on three sides, and that's it!!!! In the revoltingly-decorated bathroom the shower door could only be opened half way before it crashed against the side of the toilet. The window view was of a wall just a metre or so away. The whole space was really airless, and I felt quite claustrophobic (I don't have claustrophobia). To add to this, the waterpipes made awful, very loud groaning noises all night that kept both of us awake. The shower blocked up so that we had to paddle - and the shower seal wasn't good, so the bathroom floor flooded. We paid around 3-4 euros per person extra for breakfast, which, once we'd seen the cost of food in Venice, was actually an incredible bargain. The buffet included bread rolls and pastries, juice and hot drinks, jams, cold meats, cheese, bacon and eggs. It wasn't very good, though - quite astonishingly for an Italian hotel, the hot drinks were truly awful (they came from a cheap motorway-service-style machine) and the bread rolls were unpleasantly tough. Overall, the hotel has a nice lobby area but the rooms themselves are like rooms in a backpacker hostel. The hotel's only plus point is its location: it's on the Grand Canal with a vaporetto stop right outside for going south to San Marco (although walking can be faster) and north to Murano. It's right next door to the train station, and only a 3 minute walk from the bus station, so that travel to and from the airport and other cities in Italy is very easy and doesn't involve extortionately-priced water taxis or dragging a suitcase around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TwinCitiesBernie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location right on the Grand Canal and quite near the train station. Some of the rooms are quite small however, so dont take the first one shown. The two Balcony rooms at the front are great. Spacious, well decorated and a good view. Not to noisy. Venice however, has become somewhat of a shopping Disneyland with shops filling most main streets. It's a shame that the history and architecture arent more promenent. Get off the beaten path and stop for a coffee at 1/4 the price. Its nice out there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff, a litte gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Alnkat
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this lovely hotel during a 4 day trip to Venice. The hotel was centrally located with easy access to bus and rail stations, a 20min bus ride straight from the airport for 3 euros, it was much more expensive to get a watertaxi and would have taken over a hour so the bus is more sensible. The hotel was very clean everywhere, all the staff were exceptionally helpful, breakfast was good and lots of choice, juliano ( barman) made wonderful Bellini's and was always smiling. The rooms were spacious, beautiful tiled bathrooms with large bath and shower, large towels and warm towels rails which were handy to dry things when we were caught in a shower. There is easy access to the public water taxis right outside the hotel which go to most areas of venice,you can get a travel ticket for 12,24 36 hours depending on what you want but walking is also an option and we did lots of this exploring all the small canals , a street map was very helpful as it could be easy to get lost but it is well signposted. Food was good but shop around as there were some very expensive resturants but we found some small friendly ones near to the hotel ( out the main door of the hotel and take a left we found several along this street!) St Marks square was stunning but get there early the queues build quickly, also worth a trip up the tower 8 euros amazing views all over venice. A trip in a Gondola is a must we paid 60 euros for 40 mins for 4 people, be prepared to haggle and try getting one away from the main tourist square as its much quieter and more interesting down the smaller back street canals. We loved venice for its beautiful buildings, people, jewellry, cocktails and language which is worth a try. A unique place and we are so glad we have experienced it before its no longer there!! Go you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Enchantered Venice”
Reviews.Author: JaMichel
Reviews.Content: A very nicely located hotel to experience the magic of the city. Must-see

Reviews.Title: “Bellini Was Great”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought our three teenaged boys to Venice over Christmas and had a blast. The hotel is a short walk from the train station and located nearby the water buses and a gondola dock. The staff were friendly and helpful right from the beginning. We checked in without a hitch and our rooms were great. The boys had a superior room (with a view) that we called our home base. That said, our standard room was quite well appointed. The lobby bar was well stocked (a great spot to have a Bellini). The morning breakfast bar was well stocked with food, coffee and juices; it was replenished regularly (a Globus Tour arrived while we were there and everyone had plenty). Venice is a great city, so unique and rich with history. This hotel is a great place to call home base for day long excursions and is near to many restaurants that offer fixed price plates for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to train station!”
Reviews.Author: RadioDJChick
Reviews.Content: Venice was our favorite city we visited on our two-week tour of Italy! The weather was perfect, and you can't beat the scenery. The Bellini was right next to the train station, so there was no problem getting there. If you are looking for a view of the Grand Canal though, this won't be your first choice. The room was beautiful had everything you need. And our favorite restaurant was right across the street, sitting on the Grand Canal (fabulous fettucini and calamari!) Took a great boat tour of the Canal, and walking tour of St. Mark's...fabulous guide with interesting stories about side streets. Get the brochures for guided tours from the concierge...and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Too many Americans!”
Reviews.Author: cmsvt97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling around Italy for our honeymoon and stayed in Venice for 3 nights. This hotel couldn't be any closer to the train station. You exit the train station and walk to the left about 50 yards and there you are. It is in a great location if you want to be able to walk from the train and not have to lug your luggage over all the bridges or give it to a porter. When we walked into the lobby I felt like we were back in America. The hotel was booked with a couple of tour groups so you definitely do not get to experience Italy at the hotel. The rooms were small for US standards but about average for European standards. The bed was great -- being that we were staying in hotels for a month this made us very happy. We kept our windows open at night and had no issues with noise or smell (although we were awakened each morning by the church bells at 7:15). They do include an "American" breakfast with the room although we were not impressed by it at all (and the coffee was awful). Overall we were pleased with the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: offbeatlen
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was the result of Trafalgar Tours package. The hotel is located less than a minute from the St Lucy railroad station, and is on the Grand Canal. It is an interesting walk to the main attractions of Venice, and the route is well signed. The hotel has an efficient elevator service, and room 222 in which we stayed was perhaps the best of the three hotels we enjoyed in Italy. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was well appointed. The breakfast which was included was better than average and the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. All in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Boscolo Bellini”
Reviews.Author: Brydie
Reviews.Content: Boscolo Hotel Bellini, Venice, Italy September 12, 2008 Made reservations for this hotel in March of 2008 for travel in September, 2008. Received reservation confirmation from hotel at time of reservation and again re-confirmation, two weeks prior to travel. Upon arriving at hotel, after three air flights, one airport bus ride and one water taxi, we were told that the hotel had no rooms available and that we would be sent to another hotel. It was 9:30 at night and we had been travelling since 6 am that day. Having shown my printed confirmation, it meant nothing to the staff and they could not offer any explanation, other than they had no rooms available. We were provided with a water taxi to the Hilton Hotel, which is a very nice hotel; however about a 20 minute water taxi ride and the location of the hotel offers nothing else, except for great views from the rooftop bar. I specifically chose the Bellini because of its location close to the train station and the hustle and bustle of outdoor cafes, etc. I was most disappointed at not staying there and the hotel did not attempt to contact me to tell me that they had overbooked. I had read trip reviews about this hotel and others prior to my original booking of a hotel and by choosing the Bellini, I thought I would be safe from running into this problem. The hotel has all kinds of penalties for guest cancellations; however when they choose to cancel your guaranteed, reserved room, there seems to be no accountability. I would not recommend staying at this hotel as you cannot be guaranteed that they will have your room reserved for you, regardless of what they send you in writing. I found it totally unacceptable and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sameh_Riad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing in everything: - a.) Location; you just leave the train station and wake 30 seconds to the left and you'll find the hotel. b.) Amazing View c.) Clean d.) Helpful Staff VI. Just please note that for b.) and c.) make sure you book the superior room and not just the ordinary room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Teri2512Stafford
Reviews.Content: My now fiance and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Bellini. Having now read the reviews I can't see why people would leave a bad review ? We were originally booked into the Rezidenza Cannaregio but due to unforseen circumstances they advised us on arrival that we would need to stay at the Bellini.......this was a blessing in disguise. Not only was the hotel incredibly organised and aware of our impending arrival they were incredibly helpful, advising us of our now location etc The porter showed us to our room (201), right next to the lift. The room was an average size but perfecttly suitable, bath and shower facilities, however on the 2nd day when I wanted a bath I couldn't figure the plug out, this being due to it being broken, we mentioned it to the receptionist and immediately we were offered a different room and helped by the porter to move our belongings, this time room 312. Exactly the same decor only a slightly larger room. The beds (2 singles pushed together) were very comfortable and spacious, I had 4 wonderful nights sleep without the other half invading my space, only occasionally did he manage to relieve me of any covers. When I had a bath I found it snug, due to me being on the larger size of small (there don't seem to be many fat people in Venice) however this was preferable to a shower as I am also fairly tall and the fixed shower head was a bit to low and also more relaxing after a hot day walking around. Toilet roll never ran out and little luxuries are provided. The breakfast provided was plentiful and varied and of good standard. Venice is beautiful, I recommend a Gondola ride, although on the expensive side (100 Euros for 1 hour) there is no better way to see the REAL Venice. I would however suggest that a Gondola ride be taken early in the day as the prices increase for the more romantic evening ride. We used a wonderful Gondolier who was situated on the bridge entering the Ghetto who also provided us with interesting information on the area, I suspect not all Godolier's do this. His contact details 333 422 06 31. The hotel is situated at the top of the Grand Canal, perfect location as a waterbus 1 will use the Grand to get you to St Marks about 20 minutes (including stops). The walk to St Marks is also easy and well signposted through the main shopping streets and passed the Rialto. A trip to Murano, Burano and the Lido can be taken using the ACTV waterbuses (better to purchase a Venice card that inludes Alilaguna airport transfers as it works out much cheaper, entrance to a lot of museums and churches is also included). Overall I can't recommend the hotel enough, helpful, polite, good English speaking, courteous staff, comfortable rooms and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Honeymoon in Venice”
Reviews.Author: babeandbella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice as part of our honeymoon. Booked a deluxe room and the romantic package. We were prepared to ask for a room on the Grand Canal, but were pleasantly surprised to be told we had already been reserved one by the hotel front desk. The room was clean and was very big by European standards. The view of the canal was incredible and there was a balcony we could stand on and enjoy the scenery. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in providing maps and booking our excursions throughout our time in Venice. We would absolutely stay at this hotel again. It is also very close to the train station which allows you to avoid traveling to your hotel on the crowded vaparetto's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mini-Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randcbathgate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellini for two nights in July. We booked a double room, with breakfast included. The hotel is very well located, directly opposite the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. We arrived at 12pm, a little earlier than the stated check-in time, but our room had been cleaned and was ready for us. We had a room on the 4th floor, in a newly refurbished part of the hotel. It was really nicely decorated, and looked much better than the rooms shown on the hotel website. Having said this, not all the rooms have been refurbished, so I imagine it is a bit of a lottery which type you get, as we were not given an option when we booked. Our rate inluded breakfast, which was ok, but nothing special. Coffee and juice came out of a machine rather than being fresh, and the buffet was not replenished often, which meant you missed out on fresh fruit etc. unless you were up early. The hotel is at the opposite end of the islands from St Marks Square, but we felt this was a benefit. We definately noticed it was cheaper to eat/drink around the hotel than closer to the main sight seeing areas as well. All in all a good city break hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location-rude staff”
Reviews.Author: emmandmax
Reviews.Content: great room-ask for top floor. we had a triple which was two rooms w/ skylights and fridge! nice bathroom too. we had several encounters w/ bartender and he was downright rude. after 3 weeks traveling through Italy we knew what to expect, however it was a daily confrontation when we requested glasses and/or ice. I tipped him and that still didn't help! he once refused to give us ice! won't be back to this hotel. included breakfast was sad. eggs were like runny tofu. many large tour groups would hit breakfast and staff could not keep up w/ cleaning tables or keep enough food out. on the last day of our 3 days there it was a spartan breakfast. we were dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: AndiamoChicago
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Venice, I think the Bellini was a great hotel for the value. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the canal. We wanted to be near the train station due to an early departure, so it worked out well for us. The room was a nice size and comfortable. The large bathroom had to be fairly new - beautiful marble, huge tub. It appears they are making some updates to the hotel. There was some work being done during the day, which didn't bother us at all. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: millermaid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellini for 4 nights in April. After coming off of 3 nights in Rome and 3 nights in Florence and staying in smaller hotel rooms for those visits, the Bellini was a treat. We were happy with our room, the cleanliness of it, the hotel staff and especially the location. By American standards, this is probably not a 4 star hotel, but if you've read other reviews on TA, you know that for Europe this is the way it is. It is hectic in this area, being so close to the train station, however, we took a room in the back and though the view was nothing special, I appreciated the quiet. Once out the door, you don't spend much time in front of the hotel and within minutes you are out and about exploring all of Venice. As mentioned, distance to the train station was very close and that was so important to us because we had traveled by train from Florence, and it literally is a two minute walk fromt the train station to the hotel. We noticed that the water in the shower would run hot and cold, but this didn't happen everytime we used the shower. One evening we did not get the turndown service, which was strange as they did take care of this all of the other nights. We didn't mention it and felt it really was not a big deal. We each purchased the 36hour waterbus tickets, which also covered our ride by regular bus to the airport (Venice was our last city before heading home) so we felt that was a good deal. The tickets were $26 each. Overall, we enjoyed our experience at this hotel and would recommend it to others, especially if traveling by train. If we return to Venice, we would probably stay elsewhere, but only because now that we are familiar with the area, we would want to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Good location, right near train and vaporetto stations. Not as loud as we were worried it be. Reasonable dinner buffet, although limited selection. Small rooms. Pleasant but slow and overworked reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Christmas in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PIJLondon
Reviews.Content: The room was small but oppulently furnished. Very clean and no plumbing problems as mentioned in other reviews. Breakfast overpriced (appox 18 euros) - only had it once but it consisted of scambled eggs and bacon for hot - machine coffee and drinks on a help yourself basis - Much cheaper to have a coffee and croissant out. Beware of your hotel key (credit card) keep away from your other credit cards, otherwise you will be visiting reception on a regular basis to have it reset. Have visited Venice four times and this is by far the best location. Stayed at the other Boscolo Hotel Dei Dogi - great hotel but a long walk to all sites! Very small quiet bar, but excellent, attentive staff. No restaurant - but plenty in walking distance Would definetely go back. Beware if you get the water taxi from the airport and ask for the Ferrovia it drops you off at another stop (10 min walk away) Turn right over the bridge and keep walking down this shopping street - The Bellini is on the right (The actual Ferrovia stop is opposite!)

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel Masquerading as a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cloud9west
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel blindly through Hotwire, booking what was supposed to be a â€œ4 star hotelâ€� and a â€œgood value.â€� Our experience proved to be neither and we learned our lesson about booking a European hotel through Hotwire â€“ donâ€™t! The price we paid to Hotwire was the exact same price we could have booked it ourselves and Hotwire gave us the lowest category room (with no chance for upgrades since it was prepaid through an outside service). Also, the hotel scores 4 stars on some sites, but 3 stars on other sites. The 3 star rating is the most accurate. The location of this hotel is wonderful. Walk out of the train station, turn left and walk 2 minutes; no dragging luggage on vapporettos! As stated, we had been slammed into the lowest room category through Hotwire, but had phoned the hotel ourselves saying we would pay for an upgrade. They said they would see what they could do when we arrived. As it turned out, the hotel had room to sell us an upgrade, but checked us into an unmade room, and to make good on this faux pas, they comped our room upgrade and breakfast for our 3 night stay. Andrea, the front desk manager we dealt with, was first rate and even sent up a bottle of champagne to our new, room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Good end to the story. Venice is old and expensive, so you have to take that into consideration in any hotel. Our canal view room was very nice â€“ tall ceilings, lush drapes, excellent appointed bathroom original oils on the walls, and a nice big balcony. We did see a basic category room and it was small, low-ceiling, smelled of sewer gas, and was to the back. The breakfast bar (that they usually charge 18 Euros for) was not very good â€“ a coffee machine instead of anything fresh, scrambled eggs that were little grainy yellow curds, very stale bread and rolls, not first rate at all. There are plenty of places to grab fresh breakfast and coffee right next to the hotel (and less expensive that 18 Euros). Again, we felt that we lucked out in dealing with Andrea when we checked in. Later in our stay we phoned the front desk letting them know we had laundry that needed to be done; we also told the front desk on our way out. Upon returning that afternoon, we found that no one had picked up our laundry, and the maid had left our dirty laundry and filled-out laundry request sitting on top of our made-up bed. Not 4 star service and the front desk that day was mildly apologetic. Lessons learned â€“ great location, book it yourself directly through Boscolo Hotels and book the higher category canal view room, expect 3 star service and amenities, and you should be happy.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: marya48
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews that were not very encouraging, we needn't have worried. Our room was well appointed and very attractively decorated. Walls curtains and bedcover were all in matching material. Room was lit by beautiful glass wall lamps. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine, lots to choose from. We would stay there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “great if you take the train in, otherwise just okay”
Reviews.Author: JE1205
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during our trip to Venice, which was only one night ($300). If you take the tain to Venice this is the place to stay- it is right near the train station so if you have luggage you can quickly lug it to the hotel and save money and time by not using a water taxi. The hotel was okay, it was clean and the staff was friendly. They were very busy and for the most part pretty attentive. It took us a while to checkin because the front desk personnel answered the telephone to help another guest. The view from our room was of a wall... but I suppose if one requested a better view it would be possible as the hotel does overlook a portion of the water. There was a strange smell in our room when we came back from dinner... just a general damness that could have been from the hotel simply being in Venice. Overall, this hotel's best attribute was the location, but if I visit Venice again it would be worth it to shell out for a more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Venice and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bamapilot
Reviews.Content: We came in by train from Milan and found the hotel perfect being located so near the train station. As with most accomodations in Venice, the rooms run on the small side, but believe me, they are nice. All of the walls are padded and covered with damasque cloth (very nice). Our room was immaculate and the hotel staff are some of the nicest, most helpful that I have ever had the privilege of coming in contact with. My wife fell in love with Venice, the people and was ecstatic about MY CHOICE of hotels. As with our stay in Milan, if we are fortunate enough to return to Venice, we will stay at no other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looked rather tired”
Reviews.Author: LondonBig_G
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Bellini because it is close to the railway station and vaporetta services. The hotel reception looks okay, but the lifts were very clunky and the general decor looked a bit tired. Our room was very small and badly laid out. It was hot and the air con was feeble. The room was poorly maintained and there were problems with both washbasin and bidet. We reported the problems to reception and after about 2 hours were told that the air con was working fine (it was the sun's fault) and that nothing could be done about the washbasin or bidet. It was not disasterous, but it seemed to me that the hotel needed a huge renovation to bring it up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant but ok. Not sure if it should be rated 4 star”
Reviews.Author: RickyShome
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, as soon as we entered the room did look quite grand. However, there was no tea/coffee making facilities, and bearing in mind this is supposed to be a four star, we were expecting this as standard. In England you get those at a minimum, even in three star hotels. I personally thought the hotel was nothing more than 3 star. When I asked if I could use the hotel iron, the staff at reception informed me I would have to use the housekeeper service at 8 euros per shirt/dress! Word of advice, bring your own iron! Location was quite good though I would have preferred to be within walking distance to the bars/restaurants (all those hotels were booked up). The view from the room was very nice indeed. Staff were pleasant, quite friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: atlgrl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with a great staff! We loved the location which is just a couple of doors down from the train station. Just outside are taxis, gondolas, and vaporetti. We also liked that it was away from all the noise of St. Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: jmfh
Reviews.Content: I was for business and the hotel is located in a convenient place, near to train station and Ple. Roma so you can get there by foot. The Hotel is in one of the most 'authentic', it means less touristy, places of Venice: Cannareggio, you should walk only five minutes to reach it. The room was a single one, small but clean and quite because it was located in a small secondary street. The staff was correct, the breakfast short in choices and in quality. The shared facilities (stairs, hall, dinning room, ...), from my point of view, need some additional work in order to improve them.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: LesleyMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have just returned from Venice, we stayed at the Bellini for three nights. After staying in an unfriendly hotel in Rome and travelling up to Venice by train, the sight of a friendly face was most welcome. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they provided us with maps to get around, they spoke English very well and were always polite. The room was quite large and was probably very grand when the hotel was new. The TV worked, the shower worked and the room was clean. The only complaint I would have is that the bath and sink leaked a bit, causing us to use our towels up by putting them on the floor to soak the water up. However as the towels were renewed every day it wasn't too much of a problem. The hotel is situated in a nice place and its easy to get around by foot as everything is within walking distance. Also you come out of the train station and the hotel is two minutes to your left, very convenient. The only problem was the train station bell which rings for a very long time early on a morning, no sleeps in! The breakfast was OK not fantastic but they had tried to put on a bit of English breakfast. I would stay there again if I ever ventured to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not 4-star quality for their 4-star rating/price ...”
Reviews.Author: elleann11
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights -- the staff at check in were friendly and helpful. the hotel and room were clean, however, they were very run-down. the carpet on the staircase was torn and worn through; the marble in the bathrooms was covered with soap residue; the paint was peeling off the dining room walls; fresh coffee was NOT available with breakfast-- only machine made individual serving, which was not good; breakfast was not very good; dirty table cloths were left on vacated tables; and, lastly, we were told that they only have FOUR ICE BUCKETS for the entire hotel -- we were given our ice in a plastic bag. the hotel is in a great location, and it has a fine staff -- it's a shame that it has not been kept up. i do not understand how it received a 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JEMMBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April. It was a great hotel. Very conveniently located. Staff were very helpful though the service on the reception desk was a little slow. The room was very large (particularly for Venice) with good facilities and a view of the Grand Canal. We will stay here again next time weâ€™re in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: joymoot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at the Bellini. Not bad, and was acceptable for a short stay in Venice. Close location to the bus and train station, which was a plus, considering you'll be dragging your bags over sidewalks and bridges. Unfortunately, the train station rings it's bell 130 times (yes, we counted) at 7:15 and 8:15 am, so, don't plan on sleeping in! Room was small, bathroom had no shower door, just a half panel type thing and a bidet (kind of a space-waster). The bathroom definitely had mold on the ceilings/upper walls, and there was no fan. This brings me to my only advice. Don't sleep with your windows open! We were eaten alive by massive mosquitos that seemed to come in and live in the bathroom....We woke up to bites all over our faces and legs, and caught the culprits in the bathroom....Other than that, it was fine for 3 nights...Staff was nice and helpful, even though they checked us into an occupied room at first :) And do put your "do not disturb" sign on, as the staff doesn't knock. Ahhhh, Venice...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Regfly
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, and the staff could not have been more helpful - they gave up maps, advice, and made reservations for us. The rooms have just recently been done up so are now in top condition, ours overlooked the canal and it was very romantic to be woken by the bells of the the church next door each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: MissMJD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bellini was only a few steps away from the main train station and very easy to find.
