The check in service wasn't great; the receptionist was chatting on the phone in the back office when we arrived and there was no bell to attract attention. We waited about 5 minutes before being attended to. There was a very strong smell of damp in the reception area. Our room was ok. The bedding was clean and the towels in the bathroom were high quality. However, the room cleanlieness could have been better and there were black stains on the wallpaper (possibly from the air-conditioning unit which wasn't working). We were situated at the back of the hotel, on the ground floor and the view from our window was over a back yard to a wall. Although handy for the station and for water taxis, I'd rather stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cher179
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellini for 2 nights in Sept. 2006 and found it to be a wonderful little hotel! The outside doesn't look like much but the inside of the hotel was beautiful - murano chandeliers in the lobby and hotel rooms! Our room seemed small to American standards, but it was still comfortable. The bathroom was nice too. The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful with directions, etc. There's a waterbus stop right outside of the hotel that really helped us save time and avoided us getting lost! We took the bus from the airport to Venice and then dragged our luggage up and down bridges to reach the hotel. To go back to the airport, we took the waterbus right outside the hotel to the stop where the airport bus boarded. We recommend you do it this way! Dragging our luggage in the hot sun, after a long flight was not pleasant! We booked the package that came with a gondola ride and private boat to Murano with private tour of the glass museum. The gondola ride and the private boat to Murano were the highlights of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer13
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the bellini for 4 days in Sept 2006. Our stay was great. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suit at no additional cost. We had room 102. It had 4 doors that opened to a small veranda that over looked the grand canal. The view was amazing. The bathroom was marble and there was a tub and a shower. The room was very spacious and had venetian decorations. It was an ideal location close to the train station and the water bus stops. There was tons of shopping and resturants right there. It was a 30 minute walk to St. Marks and the Rialto. You could take the water bus right outside and that took 15 to 25 depending on which one you caught. We had a very early train to florence so the location was perfect. The area was very safe and quiet at night. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was included in our rate. There were eggs, bacon, ceral, fruit, fresh meat, cheese , rolls, and pasteries. We would definetly return again. Thank you to the Bellini for an unforgetable trip. We will definelty be back.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwrjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in August/ September and had a great time. Lovely palatial room with spectacular chandeliers. Friendly staff. Didn't worry about breakfast as there are lots of good little cafe's and bars close by. The location is excellent being very close to the Ferrovia vaporetta stops and the main train station. Coming in from the airport we used the bus to Piazzale Roma and then took the vaporetta just one stop accross the canal to Ferrovia so no need to drag cases over bridges. We prebooked a blue Venicecard [-] which we collected at the airport so we had no tickets to buy for the bus or vaporettas during our stay and this made things easy. Loved the Spritzers con Campari which we told to try by a friend who had been to Venice. It's the local Prosecco wine with Campari and soda usually served with a huge olive. The ice cream is delicious as you would expect. A wonderful city. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some described, but still mediocre”
Reviews.Author: whiskeyman510
Reviews.Content: OK, first things first. I just returned from there, and was very happy to report excellent water pressure from both hot and cold water. I also did not have a noisy airconditioner, nor was the bathroom linoleum (it was mainly marble). Those things being said, the Bellini is still not a 4 star hotel as advertised, even by European standards, which are often lower than US standards. I had issues with the TV, as the hotel provided information indicating 4 channels in English on their (so-called) satillite TV. The only consistent one was CNN, and MTV (which was sometimes in English) faded in and out. Also, contrary to what a few reviewers said about the friendliness of the staff, I found the staff was generally pretty aloof and not helpful. Our room safe did not work. In our 4 day stay, they never sent a repairman (just the bellhop who just confirmed what I already knew - that it was broken), and our request to move to a room with a working safe was met only with laughter (literally). Also the mini bar in the room was never refilled with anything taken from it during our 4 days stay. Lastly, every other hotel I have stayed in in Italy has provided a complimentary breakfast. The Bellini provided breakfast, but only after consuming it, were we told there was a charge. They had plenty of information about the breakfast (hours, location, etc) but never was there any mention it was not free as is the Italian standard. I felt it was misleading. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and being about 100 yards from the train station, it was VERY conveniently located. I have not stayed in Venice before, but I would think a better value could be had as the Bellini was also the most expensive hotel I stayed at the whole time I was in Italy, including stints in Rome and Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Motilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 5nights.Very easy to get to from Piazzale Roma just one stop on the water bus to the train station and when you get off you look to the right and you can see the hotel 2min walk. Found the location to be excellent even though it was a 25 mins walk to St.Marks the walk was interesting and gave you another aspect of Venice. You can also take the water bus which stops almost outside the hotel and you get the full benefit of viewing the whole of the Grand Canal. All other places of interest was easy to get to by foot or by canal. There was a good atmosphere outside the hotel and little bars where you could have a nightcap if needed. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful they recommended good reasonable restaurants to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: moynishan
Reviews.Content: We actually ended up coming in a day early due to my err; however, they did not have us in the system at all (we were supposed to be there the next day for 2 nights) - it seems there was a problem w/ their internet and it overbooked. We were asked to sit in the lounge area where we were treated to a long overdue cold beer (that was great) while they figured out what they could do for us. They came back and said they found a room in the hotel and could accommodate us for the whole time we were there - we were very grateful and relieved. Then we went up to the room - the smallest room (for the most price) we stayed in in Italy. There was not much room for the luggage let alone moving around in, but we figured it would be fine and there was no way we could ask to be moved since they apparently dug hard to find the room for us. Then came the bathroom (however very clean) - I'm small and I could barely move in there. The shower was way under par even for European standards (my husband is 6'3" and managed in other rooms' small showers on our trip, but this one was definitely a struggle). But the smallness of it was not the only problem - there was no cold water (yep you read that right - cold), so since no water came out of the cold faucet at all we had to take scalding hot showers (yes, extremely quick ones) all three mornings. The bathroom sink had its share of problems w/ water and pressure as well. But on to the rest of the positive stuff. Again, the staff is great - very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, esp. if you're coming in from the train station - it is literally maybe 400 meters from the station. The express water bus to Murano stops right in front of the hotel (I highly recommend Murano - better glass items and not super crowded). We spent money on the water bus and have no idea why - we were never asked to show our tickets, so buying bus tickets seemed to have been a waste of euros. The rest of Venezia is certainly walkable from the hotel but it can be a hike; however, there is public transportation (and if it's free or not is debateable, of course) which is very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NOLATravellers
Reviews.Content: The Bellini is a 4 star with a very convenient location on the Grand Canal just a short walk - 200 yards - from the train station. We paid 150 E; stayed 4 nights May 2006. Nicely decorated; plenty of atmosphere. Small lobby, not a place to linger but who cares, Venice abounds with piazzas to hang out in with a glass of wine. The first room we were brought to was tiny, dark and overlooked a busy side street - noisy. We immediately asked to be moved and this was done with a minimum of fuss. The second room was 50% larger and over a quiet alley. Keep in mind - altho the Bellini touts the Grand Canal, only 4 rooms actually overlook the canal. The windows are important as according to the front desk here and at other hotels in Italy and Austria in May, the city hadn't turned on the AC. It certainly was warm enough to warrant it but apparently the government didn't think so! Being up on a higher floor and over a quiet alley was fine. Bathroom was spacious, all marble, two sinks. We did need assistance with a shower that refused to work two mornings, the water was fine coming out of the tub spigot but not the shower. The bellman was prompt, apologetic and fixed it. The only caution on this hotel is the outrageous price for breakfast! Not posted anywhere - we had a shock when we were charged 36euroes for 2 in the salon room. Although it was a more than ample spread, hot and cold and wonderful service, we don't care to eat that much and the next several mornings were much happier walking out the hotel, turning left and and walking into a cafe/restaurant called Brek. Great cappucino, warm or cold breakfast pastries and rolls all freshly baked. For about 7euroes for two! Very convenient to the vaparetto, it's a very short walk to the stop in front of the train station. Great for coming and going from either the Piazzale Roma (from the airport or rental cars) or the train. For 150E/night, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but a trek from the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: shil0846
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellin for a night in May 2006 in a standard room. The hotel was charming and although our room was small, it was luxurious with a pretty bathroom (although no view). However, the location is a 40 minute walk from St Marco Square or a 30+ minute river bus ride. I wish I had been aware of this when I booked as it spoilt the holiday. Also, the river bus is 10 euros per person for a single ticket and the cost can add up. On the plus side the hotel is close to the river bus terminal and also the train station and the coach park.

Reviews.Title: “Very Italian!”
Reviews.Author: Paristravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellini for New Year and really enjoyed our time at the hotel and in Venice. The guy behind the bar was lovely and more than happy to keep the Amaretto flowing into the early hours, long after his shift was over! Room was small but that may just be because the bed was huge and the quietest, darkest room so great for bad sleepers! Really clean, good breakfast and fab coffee! We'd definitely go back and I recommend this hotel although it's not the cheapest!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Barossap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas for three nights. The hotel staff were really friendly and co-operative. We had booked on a deal 3 nights for the price of 2 that included breakfast also. Breakfast was eggs, bacon. sausage or continental, cereals, toast, meats etc and was fine. There was a very slight smell of what seemed to be effluent when taking the stairs to the room and it was always brief and in the very same place. The room was a decent size and the bed firm and excellent. Sheets were changed daily. This hotel is a one minute walk from the station and enjoys close proximity to all water transport yet is only a ten minute stroll to Rialto so I would say the location is good. We enjoyed a superb stay here and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTT65
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just came back from one week of traveling through 3 countries in Europe. Venice was our first stop and we were a bit nervous about this hotel because of previous reviews. It was wonderful. The hotel was beautiful , our room on the 4th floor was spotless and so pretty and we did not have any problems w/ odors. I actually asked the front desk about that problem and he said Venice in general can be a bit smelly. It depends on the season and the amount of rain. This hotel was steps away from the train station and the water bus stop and is right on the grand canal. We would go back there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: foreman41
Reviews.Content: First of all the Hotel doesnt look that nice when you arrive,wehad a Delux room 4th floor and it was VERY small, but came with a view of the canal and was clean and the bed comfortable, Bathroom very small but again clean so not bad, TV had CNN everything else Italian and the Internet which was better left alone, if you really need to get in touch use the Cyber Cafe just down the street. Next the staff where helpfull if asked but would not even say Good Morning or Hi whenever you walked by. Location was fine everything quite an easy walk away, but PLEASE if you want real Italian food try and get off the Tourist tracks, any place that has a Menu in English is just going to rip you off, get away from the Hotel the whole street running left from the Hotel is Tourist City, go further if you want to try good food. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but for a Boscolo Hotel I was dissapointed, but its clean tidy and a good Location.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in vibrant location”
Reviews.Author: Unforgettable
Reviews.Content: In reservation of our stay, we had prepaid for three nights lodging. When we arrived we were informed of an unfortunate booking mistake and we're asked if, for the first night, we would accept a deluxe room at their five star Boscolo Dei Dogi hotel with complimentary water taxis to and from that hotel. We were treated to a luxiourous rose garden suite on the lagoon. (See that review). It was so sumptuous and unbelievably beautiful that we asked about continuing our next two nights at the Dei Dogi, but for an additional 200 Euros per night (although well worth it) we could not justify the expense. So we resigned to going back to the four star Bellini and thought we would be disappointed. The Boscolo Hotel Bellini is a great hotel. We were not disappointed after the Dei Dogi, but the staff still sent us a complimentary bottle of an excellant chilled champagne. The rooms were beautifilly appointed with marble flooring, rich fabrics and murano glass chandeliers and wall lighting. We loved our room for it's elegance and the staff for their helpfulness. We had a large stone balcony facing the Grand Canal to view the gondolas and easy access to all forms of canal transportation. Also, the Bellini is located next to one of the few bridges that cross the Grand Canal which is a huge plus, but although passable, the bridge was under renovation and not as pretty as usual. The hotel is located on Rio Terra Lista Di Spagna a lovely brick passage which windingly connects to Piazza San Marco. It is a hub of activity and shopping with wonderful people watching. Amazingly, it was also so quiet at night.

HotelInfo.Name: The Boscolo Hotel Bellini
HotelInfo.Address: Lista di Spagna 116/A | Cannareggio quarter, 30121 Venice, Italy
